Experience with data replication technology and managing curated data products
Experience with collaborative coding (paired programming, peer reviews, source control)
Experience with building customer facing front ends

As business returns to normal, the candidate should expect to spend at least 2 days a week working with the team in company's office in Boulder, Colorado. ResumeInterview feedback thus far Need more resumes We ended up getting more people that claimed they knew about automatic speech recognition, but few with actual experience working with the low-level technical details. We need someone that can go a couple steps beyond integrating another vendorrsquos ASR components into a system but would have the knowledge to know how to do things that border on building such a system itself. Thus, strong programming ability, history of extracting machine learning features from acoustic signals, and knowledge of ASR Manager Call Notes bull Looking for someone who has experience in Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR). Really needing someone that has been exposed and has an understanding of Speech and Language Processing. o Project We are trying to help English language learners who are responding to tutorial sessions. They can say or write something and this program will do automatic analysis. No only are we seeing if they understand the grammar, but did they pronounce the words correctly when speaking. We are looking to for someone to be creative and help create tools to help problem solve. bull This person must have programming experience in Python. Might be open to other languages, but Python is the default. bull StatisticalMachine Learning Model comes third-this should really be under the hood of knowing the ASR. Hoping they are ML saavy-will consult more on the developing side and component capability. Hands on to help built components. Push out capabilities. bull Familiar with speech based and audio systems. bull AI exp-good to have-we apply AI technology within the company. Business Job Title Speech Processing Machine Learning Research Engineer Minimum Required Skills -Solid programming experience in modern languages such as Python, Golang, C++. -Proficiency with database technologies and software development best practices such as coding standards, code reviews, source control, build processes and testing. -Experience with speech and acoustic processing -Experience developing and working with automatic speech recognition -Experience training and working with language models (statistical and neural) -Familiarity with one or more deep learning frameworks (PyTorch, Tensorflow, etc). Experience in effectively applying GPUs in training and prediction, a strong plus. -Strong collaborative skills including understanding alternative points of view and contributing to cross-functional problem resolution. -An interest in cognitive processing and an appreciation of the difficulty in bridging educational goals and technology. -Ability and desire to solve problems pragmatically and to quickly learn new concepts and methodologies as needed. -Evidence of good communication skills. Minimum Education Requirement Bachelor's degree plus 2 years equivalent experience in a quantitative field with evidence of successfully applying speech processing and machine learning techniques to substantive problems andor Graduate degree in a related field Role We are looking for a talented, collaborative research engineer with a strong background in Artificial Intelligence and SpeechLanguage processing to join the AI Products and Solutions organization. As an RD organization, our mission is to push the boundaries of whatrsquos possible in education and to positively impact millions of learners around the globe. Degrees and formal qualifications are important, but for this position relevant experience and a proven track record to deliver are paramount. You will be working within a highly agile team responsible for developing cutting-edge educational technology with an emphasis on analyzing student language and writing to assess competencies, understanding and critical thinking. Using techniques from speech recognition, natural language processing, cognitive science, machine learning, and deep learning you will work on advancing the state of the art and enhancing the company's learning technology portfolio to solve practical problems for our customers. The ideal candidate will have broad interests in technology, language, cognition and education, who is motivated to design and implement substantive improvements to the company's educational offerings, and is highly skilled in researching and developing innovative ways to contribute to the future of learning. Responsibilities -Develop and assist in evaluation of speech and language analytics, statistical models and computational algorithms to improve the impact of company products, services and processes. -Apply a variety of machine learning techniques, from linear regression to the latest neural network modeling techniques to improve the efficacy of our educational materials and pedagogy. -Work collaboratively in cross-functional teams to advance companyrsquos AI products and services. -Participate in new product concepts and create proof-of-concept prototypes. -Create pipelines and automation to deploy machine learning models to the cloud. About us We are committed to a world that's always learning and to our talented team who makes it all possible. From bringing lectures vividly to life to turning textbooks into laptop lessons, we are improving the way people learn, whether it's one child in our own backyard or an education community across the globe. We are bold thinkers and standout innovators who motivate each other to explore new frontiers in an environment that supports and inspires us. By pushing the boundaries of technology - and each other to surpass these limits - we create seeds of learning that become the catalyst for the world's innovations, personal and global, large and small.

Job Description
SunPlus Data Group is seeking a Data & Application Systems Analyst for a State Government facility in Great River, NY

Start date: Sep 2020 - Sep 2021 (could possibly extend)

Hours are M-F, 40 hrs/week excluding holidays

**Candidates must work ON-SITE

INTRODUCTION

The Department of Information Technology (DoIT) working with the Department of Health Services (DHS) has recently implemented a commercial-off-the-shelf (COTS) covid-19 case management system called Commcare, developed by Dimagi. The implementation is being done as part of a state-wide rollout to support covid-19 case management including patient investigation and contact tracing.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Assist with maintenance and enhancement projects related to organization-wide data, reports, and systems.

Partner with clinical teams and operational teams across the Department of Health Services to to increase efficiency, reduce parallel processes, bolster application support, grow end user tool adoption, expand access to cross-functional data, and improve the ability of our stakeholders to make data-driven decisions. The candidate must be able to learn tools and processes quickly while being responsive to fluid stakeholder needs.

Application Configuration and Administration: Provides application configuration and administration services for CommCare system being used to support COVID-19 patient management efforts.

Training and Documentation: Supports training efforts to help build application capacity organization wide through specific trainings and the creation of educational materials and manuals.

Data Management and Cleaning: Assists in analyzing and cleaning data within the CommCare system used to support Suffolk County’s COVID-19 response activities.

Analysis & Report Development: Develops dashboards and reports using analytics tools such as Sisense, PowerBI, Tableau, and Excel for various internal teams, cross-departmental and cross-geographical audiences, and management.

Application and Process Design: Assists in evaluating and improving processes across the organization using CommCare stack of technology, leading requirements gathering and testing.

REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor’s degree in Public Health, Business, Information Technology, Mathematics, Statistics, or similar area
5-8 years of relevant experience

Company Description
SunPlus Data Group is a company whose senior management has logged more than 60 man-years in managing Projects Software engineering, production, and supply chain processes in Government, Aerospace / Aviation, Defense, Healthcare, Manufacturing, Energy and Communications industries. SunPlus offers a suite of market tested industry specific solutions and consulting services ranging from project portfolio management, program management, business process automation, business intelligence, and advanced analytics to staffing and outsourcing.

Over the last 20 years, SunPlus Data Group has grown from a five person technology company to a full blown consulting and project management consultancy firm. SunPlus consultants have logged thousands of billable hours working with a diverse population of clients nationwide.

SunPlus Data Group, Inc is a SBA 8(a) Certified, GSA schedule holder and Minority Owned firm based in Atlanta, GA providing services to our clients all over United States.

Project Manager for large, complex, enterprise-wide IT projects, ideally with Agile experience or have participated in transitioning from Waterfall to Agile. Experience creating detailed project plans and managing those plans including the budgeting/financial process and monthly reviews of actuals vs. forecast.

Day to Day Job Duties: (what this person will do on a daily/weekly basis)

Leadership
Provide strong, proactive and assertive leadership skills that engage multidiscipline work teams to respond to business needs for assigned projects
Makes decisions at the project team level and properly escalate those decisions that cannot be resolved on a timely basis
Lead project team members such as executives, line of business subject matter experts, controllers and schedulers through the lifecycle of a project
Manage project teams that typically includes multiple vendors with onshore and offshore resources

Project Planning
Create project management plans, set expectations, execute governance reviews and ensure the project plans are driven by organizational procedures
Integrates all elements of the plan so that interrelationships are known, accounted for and taken advantage of
Work with respective groups to secure and manage resource availability across the project team, including business resources

Scope Management
Coordinates with cross-functional project stakeholders to develop project scope, objectives, goals, and deliverables
Ensures that requirements are gathered, documented, reviewed and approved per organizational/PMO standards
Ensures projects are delivered on-time, on budget, and remain in scope. Monitors and tracks project dependencies

Schedule Development and Management
Work with assigned scheduler to create a work breakdown structure that defines all activities required for the project deliverables

Budget Development and Cost Management
Manage project budget, maintain financial plan, track actuals vs. plan, provide monthly forecasts, report monthly accruals

Issue and Risk Management
Identify record and evaluate business and technology risks, internal controls which mitigate risks, and related opportunities for project control improvement.
Ensures stakeholders are key contributors to the Issues and Risk Management process

Stakeholder Engagement
Interfaces with team members and stakeholders to anticipate and manage changes to the project, such as but not limited to, technical requirements, business requirements and schedule
Build strong relationships with project stakeholders by demonstrating an understanding of both business and IT components make the project successful

Communications Management
Establish and provide high-quality, informative written and verbal project communications, including weekly status, dashboards and project updates
Able to negotiate different viewpoints between stakeholders and suppliers, working toward solutions that are in the best interest of the client

Quality Management
Actively monitor, track and manage project tasks, timelines, attainment of established milestones and overall quality of project activities and deliverables

Minimum requirements:

5 years of Project management experience of IT projects

2 years of Agile experience

PMP certified

Enterprise Architect – Financial Services Consulting

In this role you will be part of a Consulting team responsible for defining overall information technology and business architecture solutions within our Financial Services Consulting (FS) client organizations. You will be part of the Consulting team and will translate client business requirements into a strategic view that drives organizational, process, and technology changes. You will act as an advocate for our clients, as the ultimate authority on the architecture designed to address client business problems. You will provide direction and oversight for design activities. Develop and lead the implementation of technology governance and standards that have an operational and financial impact and ensures compliance with standards.

This person works with our clients and internal teams/practices to develop future business solutions supported by a value proposition. This includes translating client’s business requirements into specific systems, applications and/or process designs for business and technical solutions. You will work with all areas of Financial Services Consulting and act as the SME to help develop solutions for our clients. You will work very closely with Sales, Digital, Consulting and Delivery teams to support new sales opportunities and existing account expansion opportunities.

Finally, you will lead solutioning across business architecture, data architecture and technical architecture with input from principal architects. Overall, we are looking for an Enterprise Architect that possesses deep Financial Services domain knowledge complimented with technical knowledge while leveraging SME specific technical architects. This person will be part of the consulting team that works with the client determining current state and how we can use technology to solve business problems. This will include understanding the trends and overall FS business along with being able to communicate effectively with technology to build out solutions.

Understands competitive analysis and proactively positions of our solutions to improve our win rate and close rate

We are currently seeking a Business Readiness Consulting Leader to join our team in Plano, Texas (US-TX), United States (US).

Our clients are undergoing massive amounts of change, much of it driven by digital agendas, including automation and related advanced tools such as AI and machine learning, journey to the cloud, application rationalization, systems integrations, alternate technology delivery models, and new ways of working uncovered and created by the current pandemic environment. Great leaders know it takes alignment across people, process, and technology to drive a successful business strategy. The Business Readiness Practice of NTT DATA Services focuses on the people and process elements of this equation, improving outcomes and driving ROI though our clients’ most challenging initiatives.

Our consultants work across industries, bringing expertise in People & Organizational Change (OCM, associate readiness, driving adoption, behavior change, and learning & development), as well as Business Analysis & Process Optimization and Strategic Program Management. We are looking for a senior leader to join our practice and be a part of continuing to build and implement the go to market strategies to serve our clients across industries, with particular emphasis on People & Organizational Change. This senior leader's responsibilities will include practice and offering development, people leadership, business development, advisory consulting, solution design, and team mobilization across our clients.

This person will report to the Business Readiness Consulting senior practice lead, who is accountable for all aspects of the practice. We are looking for an experienced, energetic, and entrepreneurially driven leader to help us continue to grow this practice within one of the world’s leading IT innovators. This individual will be responsible for driving go-to-market activities, acting as a subject matter expert and thought leader on the people side of change, as well as participating in the creation of broad-ranging consulting solutions. S/he is responsible for developing, managing, and expanding the practice, as well as delivering consulting services to our clients.

As a leader, s/he is also responsible for recruiting, retaining, and developing Business Readiness consultants, our most precious and valuable resource. Our consulting leaders work across NTT DATA businesses partnering with other enterprise-wide and industry-specific consulting practices, technology development and delivery teams, client relationship management teams, and clients in all industries. We also expect our leaders to contribute to thought leadership and analyst and market facing research and publications.

The ideal candidate will have extensive management consulting experience with a large, mature firm (e.g. Big 4 or next tier firms) and a proven track record solutioning across multiple clients, navigating complex organizations, and providing thought leadership on the people side of change in the digital world. They will have a have a proven track record as an "inspiring storyteller." They will be a “first-in-person” for conversations with clients and internal partners about the Business Readiness Practice and the Consulting organization more broadly, selling and educating within and across the organization regarding the Practice’s capabilities and services. Furthermore, they should be motivated by working in a highly entrepreneurial, less structured, hands-on, high-energy environment where the focus is on working collaboratively to build and grow quickly, and at scale.

Responsibilities:
Identify market priorities and provide insight into sales and client leadership
Partner with sales and client teams on account strategy and business development planning
Drive client solutioning
Deliver high-quality consulting services and develop relationships across our client portfolios
Promote the NTT DATA Services and Consulting brand through thought leadership and collateral/asset development
Represent NTT DATA Services at industry conferences and forums
Drive the development of assets (e.g., services, offerings, tools, accelerators, etc.) and intellectual property (e.g., playbooks)
Identify, develop, and mentor the next generation of consultants in Business Readiness

Minimum 8 years’ of experience working with businesses providing change management and organizational transformation solutions in support of large-scale change programs focused on the people side of change

Minimum 3 years’ experience as a people manager and leader with responsibilities for identifying, developing, and leading resources in Business Readiness

Job Description
SunPlus Data Group is seeking an IT Project Manager for a State Government facility in Great River, NY

Start date: Sep 2020 - Sep 2021 (could possibly extend)

Hours are M-F, 40 hrs/week excluding holidays

**Candidates must work ON-SITE

INTRODUCTION

The Department of Information Technology (DoIT) working with the Department of Health Services (DHS) has recently implemented a commercial-off-the-shelf (COTS) covid-19 case management system called Commcare, developed by Dimagi. The implementation is being done as part of a state-wide rollout to support covid-19 case management including patient investigation and contact tracing.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

The following responsibilities are expected of the technology project manager
Lead project planning, direction, execution and completion.
Facilitate the definition of project scope, goals and deliverables.
Collaborate with the Department of Information Technology (Do IT) and Department of Health Services leadership to assemble and manage project resources.
Liaison with New York State Department of Health (NYSDOH) IT team and NYSDOH IT contractors
Develop detailed work plans, including breakdown structures, project milestones, risk assessment / management plans, staffing needs and project timelines.
Drive decision making, risk management and issue resolution.
REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor's degree in computer science or related IT discipline.
8+ years of overall IT experience with significant understanding of software implementation & development
Experience with Health related software, including CommCare a plus.

Company Description
SunPlus Data Group is a company whose senior management has logged more than 60 man-years in managing Projects Software engineering, production, and supply chain processes in Government, Aerospace / Aviation, Defense, Healthcare, Manufacturing, Energy and Communications industries. SunPlus offers a suite of market tested industry specific solutions and consulting services ranging from project portfolio management, program management, business process automation, business intelligence, and advanced analytics to staffing and outsourcing.

Over the last 20 years, SunPlus Data Group has grown from a five person technology company to a full blown consulting and project management consultancy firm. SunPlus consultants have logged thousands of billable hours working with a diverse population of clients nationwide.

SunPlus Data Group, Inc is a SBA 8(a) Certified, GSA schedule holder and Minority Owned firm based in Atlanta, GA providing services to our clients all over United States.

About Us

Just as the field of Data Science is growing and ever-changing, so is our team: we’re on the hunt for talented instructors who are passionate about what they do and want to make a difference in the education of the world’s up-and-coming data scientists — our students.

The NYC Data Science Academy prides itself on housing the most comprehensive 12-week intensive boot camp in data science methodologies, providing theoretical, practical, and hands-on knowledge to our scholars. We nurture top talents in the industrial & academic world into industry-ready data scientists, by equipping them with knowledge, technical skills, and insights aiming at maximal impacts to the business world. We adapt faster than the quickest machine learning algorithms out there — with content that reflects research and application in the growing industry and teaching expertise which goes beyond extraordinary.

That’s where you come in.

From our part-time weekend/evening classes to our part-time online and full-time in-person boot camps, our courses are both designed in-house and taught by our robust team of data scientists and engineers. Instructors have the opportunity of taking part in corporate training and consulting client projects, building both data science and big data solutions. We encourage collaboration and positive change in not only our students and clients but also in our team. Nerding out is also highly encouraged.

Responsibilities
Train in-person or online boot camp students, the next generation of data scientists, on a wide range of topics ranging from statistics, probability, SQL, R/python coding, data analysis, machine learning, deep learning, and big data, etc. Topics in Big Data to include:
Hadoop and MapReduce, HDFS, Hive
Apache Hive
Spark
Spark SQL
Spark Machine Learning
Docker
Develop, evaluate, and maintain cutting-edge technical content for training experiences relevant to audiences with a diverse set of educational backgrounds and industry experience.
Tailoring teaching content for both corporate and client training.
Guide and mentor our students inside and outside of the classroom for their industry-ready projects. Help to orient our students’ learning toward the target industries.
Lead by example as a data scientist, to be an excellent role model for our industry-ready students.
Cooperate with marketing/admission teams by participating in the student enrollment/admission procedure and by developing relevant content for them.
Participate in periodic training workshops to sharpen the relevant skill-sets.
About You
Minimum of a Master’s Degree in a Quantitative Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics-related field; Computer Science and Statistics preferred.
Proficiency in statistical computing/machine learning and/or programming in R and/or Python.
Experience/extensive knowledge in R or Python data analysis.
Teaching experience in undergraduate or graduate level coursework in STEM required.
Demonstrated experience/knowledge of Statistics and Machine Learning from both theoretical and applied perspectives.
Experience in developing a curriculum or providing training in a client-facing endeavor.
A good sense of the relevance of academic data science to industrial applications.
Forward thinking with a strong growth mentality, i.e. constantly strengthening yourself on all fronts relevant to the growth of our school.
Passionate about teaching and helping your students succeed in their careers.
A team player who can multitask if necessary and can step up to new challenges in a growing company.
Perks
Competitive salary, adjustable hours, and flexible vacation policy.
Benefits include 401k retirement plan and medical, dental, vision insurances.
Opportunity to train, research, and learn in the field of data science on-the-job; a chance to interact with active data science communities through conferences, Meetup events, etc.
Completely stocked snack pantry.
High-quality computational equipment.

Overview


SMS is seeking an Application Developer for our contract at Kirtland AFB. The ideal candidate provides server hardware, software, operating system, and application development support to the Air Force Research Laboratory (AFRL) by administering and engineering systems managed within the application development team.

SMS has been serving the advanced information technology needs of the federal government since 1976, delivering talented teams and innovative, cost-effective solutions and services to support our customers’ missions for more than 40 years. SMS is headquartered in McLean, Virginia, with offices and on-site operations at customer locations throughout the United States. As a dynamic systems integrator, SMS offers proven solutions in engineering, operations, cybersecurity, and digital transformation. With expertise in modernizing and optimizing legacy infrastructure and systems, ensuring operational efficiency, and designing, implementing, and managing secure environments, SMS supports business and mission goals with proficiency, quality, and integrity. Join our team of top talent in supporting the federal government. Apply Today!

Responsibilities


The application developer should have Systems administrator experience in supporting large enterprise environments by administering and maintaining Microsoft operating systems 2012/2016 server operating systems and SQL database instances. The candidate should have MS SharePoint Site Collection Administrator experience, be familiar with administering Microsoft Internet Information Services (IIS), and familiarity with administration and development of a cloud based instance of Service Now. The candidate will be required to develop software in support of all software life-cycle activities with a focus on Agile, Waterfall, or Spiral methodologies, based on AFRL application requirements.

Job Responsibilities:
Design, develop, test and deploy applications utilizing technologies including but not limited to JavaScript, CSS, HTML, ASP.NET, and/or C#.
Assist in project development including capturing functional and technical requirements.
Implement and follow agile/scrum processes.
Responsible for performance and code quality.
Implement/improve automation (in code, test, and deployment).
Support QA processes and deployments.
Should be able to lead and mentor the junior team members.
Install new/rebuild existing servers and configure hardware, peripherals, services, settings, directories, storage, etc. in accordance with AFRL client and project requirements
Integrate AFRL applications with various data sources, which include flat files and existing databases (SQL, Access, or similar)
Develop and maintain installation and configuration procedures for managed systems
Handle ongoing maintenance of server operating systems such as service pack installations, hot fixes, and software upgrades
Familiarity applying Defense Information Systems Agency Security Technical Implementation Guides (DISA STIGs)
Maintain service lifecycle management information, and ensure new services adhere to government enterprise standards.
Utilize government provided tools and methodologies to support service lifecycle management activities, experience with ServiceNow preferred
Support web content migration and integration to AFRL and AF public facing websites
Follow policies and procedures for change and incident management.
Required Skills/Experience
Ability to apply standard software engineering methods and project lifecycle management techniques to deliver sound software and documentation.
Ability to write and update user and administrator documentation for applications. (All documentation will be in compliance with customer specifications.)
Ability to work independently or collaboratively with other developers.
Ability to conduct service performance assessment and scalability planning.
Experience with Site Collection Management/Administration of MS SharePoint 2013/2016
Experience in assisting individuals in problem solving utilizing the potential of SharePoint as it relates to their job function.
Experience in establishing and maintaining relationships with business stakeholders/users.
Qualifications


Clearance
Active DoD SECRET clearance is required
Certifications
Minimum DoD 8570 IAT-II (Sec+ CE) certification required
Microsoft certifications preferred (MTA, MCSA, MCSD, MCSE)
Education
Bachelor’s degree in a Business Management or MIS related field preferred, or experience in lieu of degree; High School diploma required if no existing higher education diplomas
Experience
Three to five years’ experience in website hosting/development, MS SharePoint, and .NET application development, and experience with DISA security standardization processes and application of DISA STIGs.
Applicant must possess refined critical thinking skills, should be a self-starter, may direct the activities of other team members, diplomatic, multi-task capable, adaptive to a dynamic environment, dependable and reliable.
Prior experience in a government consulting services environment is preferred.
SMS is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Duties and Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Assist Sales Managers in managing prospects
Each morning perform research on website and other campaign leads and route findings to the sales team
Identify the following by using their company website, LinkedIn, ZoomInfo
ADD to HubSpot with “tags”
Main Contacts
name
email
title
phone number
address
Research the Company and provide a brief overview of the business
ADD to HubSpot with “tags”.
If you find something good (new contact – send it to Account Executives)
Call in to assigned accounts and those not “active” with the goal of gaining company insight and information to pass along to sales managers
Who is new, who has left, who has been promoted
Remove bad contacts in HubSpot
Expectations for each outbound call: call and contact documentation in HubSpot, make contact or leave VM, send follow up email from HubSpot, schedule follow-up call, all relevant information documented in HubSpot.
Generating interest/getting introductory calls scheduled
Gain direct contact information of prospects (emails, phone numbers, etc.)
Help facilitate meetings/appointments with prospects
Schedule and attend initial discovery calls
Complete discovery questionnaires
Provide ongoing prospect support as required by the sales managers
Participate in Sales Manager’s bi-weekly team meetings
Call out on MQLs from campaigns, webinars, conferences, etc.
Look over list of “customers” and make sure progress is being made in all verticals.
Keeping HubSpot Database current
Methodical “Top 2 Bottom Reviews” includes:
Assure Company properties all in place
Go through each contact already in HubSpot with a defined triage process (includes checking LinkedIn and ZoomInfo for updates, set properties, call/email or if Top exec, assure task is set for outside's next call/email, inactive/move, write up any learnings on Pinned account overview)
Go through ZoomInfo and add new contacts - and if “Top” contact, assign task to outside, if non-top, call/email directly
Review of LinkedIN connection for Top Prospect (folks not found via
ZoomInfo) for new names and add/call or assign task
Clean and build the database that feeds marketing, outside sales, and builds brand awareness with a focus on the top 50 large prospects
This should be done via a defined account triage process ("Top to Bottom review)
#1 objective is to find new, top contact for Sales Managers to contact and make sure all key decision-makers are tagged properly and tasks assigned.
#2 objective is to assure all non-top prospects are contacted to gather information about #1 and upcoming projects
#3 is to tag 'Weak' prospects so that we do not spend time on future Top2Bottom reviews, thereby making the process as focused as possible
Outreach for events and follow-up to events and conferences
These are typically time sensitive
Working with Marketing team
Call out on MQLs from campaigns, webinars, conferences, etc.
Help coordinate invitations, pump-up number of attendees at monthly webinars
Ensure all contacts have proper “tags” (ensures prospects receive marketing materials)
Assist with pre and post-conference call-downs to set up meetings and generate interest

At Sisu, we're building a software platform that empowers people to make better decisions using data. Based on years of cutting-edge research at Stanford, Sisu enables users to quickly and comprehensively understand what’s driving their key metrics, so they never miss a window of opportunity to act.

Sisu is a fundamental rearchitecture of how users interact with data. Instead of relying on users to tell us what they want to see, as in traditional dashboarding systems, Sisu predicts users’ intent based on their metrics of interest, past behaviors, and other organizations like them. We take this kind of predictive analysis for granted in consumer applications (e.g., Netflix, Google, Facebook), but the hardest interface design and ranking problems lie in making private data found in everyday organizations actionable. The key problem we’re solving as a first step in this direction is to help identify what’s driving change in key metrics like revenue, retention, and churn among the enormous set of factors like user demographics, campaigns, and acquisition channels. To do so, we combine statistical analysis and machine learning at scale to provide users personalized, real-time diagnoses of changes in their metrics via an explainable, interpretable user interface.

As a Sr. Front End Engineer, you’ll be a subject matter expert shaping the future of Sisu’s product interface - a web application that our customers will rely on to “get the facts” to make data driven decisions. You’ll have the opportunity to work on technical challenges including developing our information architecture and solving unique problems, including how to represent statistical data in a digestible way to end users of various knowledge levels.
What you'll do:
Scale our Typescript / React / Redux front-end
Provide technical leadership to drive consensus based on empirical evidence
Navigate ambiguity with an open and curious cross-functional team
Understand our end user (data analyst) to eventually build a general use product
Craft a unique user experience that brings value to global brands. See Samsung and Upwork.
Actively partner with product and design to architect user empowering interfaces with performance and scalability in mind
Cultivate your design skills and transform Figma mocks into working prototypes
Shape the engineering culture through mentorship as our small, dynamic team grows
Actively participate in customer POCs to optimize customer experience and adoption.

About you:

Experience building user-facing products

Req ID: 94288

NTT DATA Services strives to hire exceptional, innovative and passionate individuals who want to grow with us. If you want to be part of an inclusive, adaptable, and forward-thinking organization, apply now.

We are currently seeking a Sr. Solution Architect - Low/No code solutioning expertise (Appian, Out Systems, Sales Force, MS Dyn to join our team in McLean, Virginia (US-VA), United States (US).

Job Responsibilities:

NTT DATA Services is searching for a Public-Sector Sr. Solution Architect whose primary responsibility will be to collaborate with the Technical Practices in the pursuit of new business contracts. Their charter will be to align client requirements and position NTT DATA Services to win new business engagements by leading all technology solutions development.

This senior-level IT leader is expected to provide the vision and strategy to develop scalable repeatable processes and solutions in complex Public Sector environments, enhancing the company's competitiveness and to smoothly integrate existing service offerings into new deals.

We are seeking a high impact player with a proven record of putting together solutions ranging from project based deliverables to structured, long-term technology outsourcing deals in the $10M up to $1B range, coupled with broad knowledge that spans a wide range of application and infrastructure capabilities and their respective cost structures. This includes how these capabilities must be assembled into an operational delivery model that is both financially and technically sound. In addition, this business development specialist must have worked on deals involving third party consulting companies that advise on outsourcing of information technology.

Excellent interpersonal communication skills are a must with an emphasis on sound presentation abilities. This person must have solid executive presence as this role will require frequent contact with executives, internal and on client sites. This includes the ability to immediately establish and manage critical customer relationships at the Executive level, including technical buyers and key project stakeholders.

Sound financial and business acumen are essential, as the role will require the ability to manage, interpret and develop financial models and to respond appropriately to new business cycles across the scope of service offerings.

We are seeking a skilled negotiator; an individual who is able to craft and articulate how the value of the benefits of the "solution" outweigh the client's objections and come to a comfortable purchase decision that delivers both tangible business results to the client and a profitable engagement for NTT DATA Services.

Required Skills and Experience:

Minimum of ten plus (10+) years of progressive / successful consultative business development solutions experience. Proven track-record of success in a senior IT position. The preferred experience base will have been gained in Information Technology Outsourcing (ITO) with Federal and State & Local customers.

Must possess a demonstrated track-record of structuring and winning long-term deals in the $10M to $1B range. This includes being able to understand the customer’s challenges to develop a blended-combination of technology and business solutions encompassing financial

models, service definitions, service level expectations and timeframes to help them meet their mission. This will be reflected by a background of leadership in the pursuit and closure of multi-year ITO and/or BPO services agreements.

Broad knowledge that spans a wide range of capabilities and their respective cost structures in the areas of managed services, end-to-end data center outsourcing, cloud advisory, and cloud transformation. Specific skills and experience in both AWS and Microsoft Azure are required. Knowledge of third-party tools as well as ITIL, Agile, SAFe, and DevSecOps methodologies is desired. This includes how these capabilities must be assembled into an operational delivery model that is both financially and technically sound.

Must understand the "numbers" and be able to drill down into the details and make the business case from financial perspective in developing accurate and standardized costing (pricing models) for delivery solutions. This will be supported by "hands-on" experience in managing, interpreting and executing balance sheets. Excellent planning and organizational skills-will bring the ability to respond appropriately to new business cycles across the scope of service offerings.

Strong executive presence and professional image. Exceptional communication skills (written and verbal). Ability to develop executive level (value-based) conversations with senior level decision makers (CEO, COO, CFO, CIO, etc.) and put together, or deliver, value-based proposals to clients in the targeted industry sectors.

A team player; someone comfortable working in a highly collaborative, team-oriented culture. Technical proposal writing skills a must. Must have the ability to effectively utilize and lead/direct Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) during the solutions development and sales pursuit process. Must be action and results-oriented - a "take-charge" leader with strong business case development and closing skills.

Must be willing to travel as business needs dictate.

Job Summary

Business is about more than just setting goals and making sales. At our company, we believe that business is about developing relationships with our partners and providing them with top-quality products and the services they need. As our business development manager, you'll be responsible for arranging the deals that makes this a reality. We invite qualified candidates to complete an application and learn more about our company. Together, we can take the company to the next level.

Set goals to ensure that sales quotas are met and all business team members are performing adequately.

Track the sales cycle to see potential clients through the lifetime of their partnership with us, and ensure they are satisfied every step of the way.
Strategize new approaches for attracting clients and making sales in a B2B context and in environments outside of your typical sales regimen.

Responsibilities

Key responsibilities include the following:
Support the celebrity and branded entertainment strategy for the American Red Cross within annual, organization-wide campaigns as well as in times of regionally and nationally scoped disaster preparedness, response and recovery efforts
Build and nurture relationships with celebrities and media properties (music, TV, film) to support the Red Cross
Develop processes for stewarding these relationships
Cultivate new prospects and introductions by leveraging industry contacts
Steward members of the National Celebrity Cabinet and other long time celebrity supporters and identify opportunities to keep them engaged and committed
Work with celebrities and media properties to develop PSAs
Contribute to our work with production teams, managers, publicists, etc.

Provide guidance to Chapters, lines of business, and partnering functions on celebrity recruitment strategies, policies, procedures and best practices. Liaise with international partners on globally-scoped activities.

Strong interpersonal and communication skills, and a comfort in dealing with all levels of talent and management.

Job Description:
POSITION SUMMARY: BASIC FUNCTION

The Employee Engagement Specialist supports employee engagement programs and initiatives by utilizing tools and methodologies to develop and execute programs that continuously elevate the employee experience and the full employee life cycle. Supports efforts to increase employee engagement with a focus on on-boarding, employee communications, employee and corporate social responsibility events, recognition, and innovation. Conducts analyses to review program success and identifies opportunities for improvement. In addition, supports other HR functions (benefits, talent acquisition, talent development, etc.) in designing new programs, improving our intranet, and building templates to drive improved experiences.

This position requires strong interpersonal skills and project management skills necessary to collaborate and manage local resources to execute events, coordinate communications, and support enterprise-wide programs (e.g. wellness, ramp-up etc.).

Regular, predictable attendance is essential for satisfactory performance.

**Candidates will need to provide writing samples and an example of creative project description or outline.**

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Plan and execute engagement initiatives in alignment with employee value proposition strategies and established or new engagement programs.
Analyze employee life cycle to identify opportunities and best practices; seeks employee insights through engagement surveys, conversations with employees, and insights gathered from managers. Recommend new ideas and solutions for experience improvements utilizing data and KPIs to help inform and influence the business.
Design and implement a world-class onboarding and assimilation program.
Create and prepare monthly employee newsletter.
Create, plan, and implement ongoing employee engagement activities for multiple offices in the US, including remote workers.
Conduct research, analyze data, and report on employee engagement best practices and external benchmarking. Recommend engagement initiatives.
Oversee the company-wide Employee Activities Committee, ensuring activities are carried out consistently in all locations.
Manage and organize corporate social responsibility events, including communication, community outreach, and participation.
Create ongoing energizing initiatives such as digital boards, recognition programs and other creative methods/tools. Prepare presentations, forms, and reports using multiple formats.
Participate in overhauling and updating company intranet to increase ease of use and engagement.
Perform other duties as assigned.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES
Strong proficiency with computers to include the utilization of Microsoft programs such as Microsoft Teams, Word, Excel, Power Point and Outlook. Experience with SharePoint strongly preferred.
Passionate for creating engaging work environments and energizing people!
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to influence cross-functional teams and vendor partners.
Strong organization, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to develop creative and compliant solutions.
Exceptional planning and organizational skills including strong attention to detail.
Project management experience.
Able to work in a team environment.
Able to manage stress and/or fast-paced effectively.
Able to be highly confidential.
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE
High school diploma or GED.
Bachelor’s degree in HR, psychology, business, communications or related field.
5+ years of HR experience with emphasis on Employee Engagement and Onboarding.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
Primarily sitting with some walking, standing, and bending.
Able to hear and speak into a telephone.
Close visual work on a computer terminal.
Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate any required computer keyboard, mouse, and other technical instruments.
Able to lift and carry up to 20lbs.
WORK CONDITIONS
Standard office environment
Extensive daily usage of workstation or computer.
Some remote work permitted.
SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS
Occasional local and domestic travel, up to 20%.
Ability to work hours outside normal business hours, evenings, and weekends, as necessary for employee or corporate social responsibility events.
Must possess a current, valid state-issued driver’s license.
Must satisfactorily pass company-required background check process.

Role Responsibilities:

-Ability to analyze and process transactions, with a strong understanding of Claims processing and utilization of Desk Level Procedures

-Interact with customers and internal departments to resolve issues and accurately process claims

-Properly adjudicate claims based on your knowledge of covered benefits, insurance and provider contracts

-Determine plan liability as well as diversion and recovery activity for claims

Requirements:

-18-36 months of relevant experience

-High school diploma or equivalent required

-Associates degree, technical college or some college course work preferred

-Medicare knowledge preferred

-Proficient in Microsoft Office products including Word, Excel, and Outlook

Preferences:

-Experience using ikaSystems, Facets, Market Prominence or similar system preferred

- Demonstrate professionalism with peers, subordinates, superiors and customers

-Manage time and prioritize effectively; demonstrate an ability to cope with a complex and changing environment

**Required schedule availability for this position is Monday-Friday 8:00 AM to 4:40 PM CST. The shift timings can be changed as per client requirements.

Data Systems Analysts, Inc. is searching for a Senior Information Security Analyst. Job Description: The ideal candidate will report directly to the program manager and have strong leadership skills and the ability to lead teams, tasks and projects of 5+ junior, mid, and senior level resources with limited supervision. The Senior Information Security Analyst will be an integral part of a team responsible for supporting the development and maturation of an Agency-wide information security (InfoSec) program for a large civilian Federal agency. The candidate should have strong data analysis skills, keen attention to detail, and the ability to handle and prioritize multiple tasks and deadlines. The candidate will serve as a subject matter expert with regards to the Risk Management Framework (RMF) and all associated information security policies and procedures and should possess in-depth knowledge of applying, selecting and testing the NIST family of security controls. Primary Responsibilities: * Advising senior-level stakeholders on InfoSec initiatives including compliance, awareness and training, and security operations. * Leading Independent Validation and Verification (IV&V) efforts on security authorization/ATO packages to ensure compliance to agency requirements. * Leveraging the existing Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) tool, Telos Xacta (or an alternate like CSAM or RSA Archer), to track and reconcile findings from assessments, audits, and vulnerability scans. * Coordinating government data calls (FISMA, FMFIA, BDR, etc.) and monthly reports. Client CyberScope experience a plus. * Assessing the effectiveness of the InfoSec and privacy training program and leading the collection, analyzation, and presentation of enterprise-level InfoSec performance metrics. * Managing InfoSec Program POA&Ms, including advising on remediation efforts. * Providing administrative support to Xacta (or equivalent GRC tool) users and authoring operational procedures. * Working closely with senior agency security officials, system owners, information system security officers (ISSOs) and other stakeholders to advise and implement security solutions. * Advising CDM implementation efforts. * Identify opportunities for efficiencies in work process and innovative approaches. * Participating in team problem solving efforts and offer ideas to solve client issues. * Conducting relevant research, data analysis, and developing reports. * Preparing and assisting in the development of policy and procedures for program-level management and promoting consistency in program management best practices. * Implementing processes and procedures to monitor risk across programs / projects. * Preparing briefings to executive team to debrief the results of studies, analyses, and plans. * Assisting the client leadership in reviewing monthly project progress, documenting issues, and monitoring resolution. * Leading related business development efforts, as requested. Minimum Qualifications: * US Citizenship. * Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Business, or other related scientific or technical discipline is required. Four (4) additional years of experience in IA/Information Security will be an acceptable substitute for a Bachelor's degree. * Minimum of eight (8) years of IA specialized experience, including applying, analyzing and assessing information systems and security controls (NIST SP800-53, Revision 4). * Minimum of three (3) years in a leadership capacity and demonstrated ability to delegate work and track work products from assignment to delivery. * Ability to work with limited supervision and meet multiple project milestones and deadlines as required by the client. * Excellent written and oral communication skills including delivery of client-ready work products and the ability to communicate complex technical issues to senior stakeholders and non-technical staff. * Knowledge and understanding of integrating the security lifecycle into the system development lifecycle (SDLC). * Experience working with Federal Information Security Modernization Act (FISMA) requirements and NIST guidelines. * Demonstrated ability to prioritize and manage competing work assignments in a time sensitive environment. * Ability to weigh business risks and enforce appropriate information security measures. * Keen attention to detail and the ability to solve problems using best practices and systematic approach. Preferred Tool Experience * ForeScout * BigFix * Tenable Nessus * Telos Xacta IA Manager (or similar tool like CSAM, RSA Archer, etc.) * CDM Dashboard * SharePoint * Qlik Sense Preferred Qualifications: * Two (2) IT industry certifications, including at least one (1) advanced security certifications (e.g., CISSP, CISM or equivalent). * Interest in learning the concepts of business development and capturing new business. Job Description
SunPlus Data Group is seeking an IT Project Manager for a State Government facility in Great River, NY

Start date: Sep 2020 - Sep 2021 (could possibly extend)

Hours are M-F, 40 hrs/week excluding holidays

**Candidates must work ON-SITE

INTRODUCTION

The Department of Information Technology (DoIT) working with the Department of Health Services (DHS) has recently implemented a commercial-off-the-shelf (COTS) covid-19 case management system called Commcare, developed by Dimagi. The implementation is being done as part of a state-wide rollout to support covid-19 case management including patient investigation and contact tracing.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

The following responsibilities are expected of the technology project manager
Lead project planning, direction, execution and completion.
Facilitate the definition of project scope, goals and deliverables.
Collaborate with the Department of Information Technology (Do IT) and Department of Health Services leadership to assemble and manage project resources.
Liaison with New York State Department of Health (NYSDOH) IT team and NYSDOH IT contractors
Develop detailed work plans, including breakdown structures, project milestones, risk assessment / management plans, staffing needs and project timelines.
Drive decision making, risk management and issue resolution.
REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor's degree in computer science or related IT discipline.
8+ years of overall IT experience with significant understanding of software implementation & development
Experience with Health related software, including CommCare a plus.

Company Description
SunPlus Data Group is a company whose senior management has logged more than 60 man-years in managing Projects Software engineering, production, and supply chain processes in Government, Aerospace / Aviation, Defense, Healthcare, Manufacturing, Energy and Communications industries. SunPlus offers a suite of market tested industry specific solutions and consulting services ranging from project portfolio management, program management, business process automation, business intelligence, and advanced analytics to staffing and outsourcing.

Over the last 20 years, SunPlus Data Group has grown from a five person technology company to a full blown consulting and project management consultancy firm. SunPlus consultants have logged thousands of billable hours working with a diverse population of clients nationwide.

SunPlus Data Group, Inc is a SBA 8(a) Certified, GSA schedule holder and Minority Owned firm based in Atlanta, GA providing services to our clients all over United States.
Job Title: IT Project Manager (Implementation / Health Data) - Government

Job Description:
Commercial Sales Representative

Omni Data is a leading network solutions enterprise that specializes in physical access security and network infrastructures. For over 20 years, Omni has engaged in deep collaboration with clients to seamlessly develop their networks, ensuring they function securely and reliably.

Omni originated in the tri-state area, representing a variety of industries, including manufacturing, financial services, hospitality, schools, and government. Today, Omni deploys its expertise and high-quality network design capabilities for clients globally.

The primary focus of the commercial sales representative is to develop new sales opportunities and generate profitable revenue growth. The ideal commercial sales representative will have a proven track record of hunting for, quoting, and closing commercial accounts. This individual must demonstrate a thorough understanding of the sales cycle processes as our integrated security solutions will be presented to business owners, executives, directors, and facility managers within the commercial space. If chosen for this role you will be responsible for
Self-generate leads and maximize company provided leads. Close outright equipment/installation sales and generate recurring monthly revenue.
Hunt for new leads through: leads group participation, canvassing, social media, centers of influence, existing relationships, referrals

Conduct building surveys to support the development of estimates
Build and maintain consultative relationships while understanding the client's risk profile and budget
Demonstrate the value of solutions you presented to best satisfy customer needs
Work effectively with internal clients to provide attractive quotes to customers and project manage the accounts that he/she sells
Work in a fast-paced environment with many moving parts
Drive to customer locations as necessary

Bachelor's Degree in a business-related field with at least 3 years of experience of selling electronic security to commercial clients
Excellent organizational skills
Excellent communication, customer service, and computer skills
Proficient with Microsoft Office (Powerpoint, Excel, and Word)
Experience in intrusion alarm, IP cameras, and access control is a requirement
Ability to read wiring diagrams/schematics
Must have a valid drivers license

Able to be highly confidential.

Close visual work on a computer terminal.

Job Title: Oracle Business Intelligence / Data Warehouse Functional Leader

Job Description:
About Us

Just as the field of Data Science is growing and ever-changing, so is our team: we’re on the hunt for talented instructors who are passionate about what they do and want to make a difference in the education of the world’s up-and-coming data scientists — our students.

The NYC Data Science Academy prides itself on housing the most comprehensive 12-week intensive boot camp in data science methodologies, providing theoretical, practical, and hands-on knowledge to our scholars. We nurture top talents in the industrial & academic world into industry-ready data scientists, by equipping them with knowledge, technical skills, and insights aiming at maximal impacts to the business world. We adapt faster than the quickest machine learning algorithms out there — with content that reflects research and application in the growing industry and teaching expertise which goes beyond extraordinary.

That’s where you come in.

From our part-time weekend/evening classes to our part-time online and full-time in-person boot camps, our courses are both designed in-house and taught by our robust team of data scientists and engineers. Instructors have the opportunity of taking part in corporate training and consulting client projects, building both data science and big data solutions. We encourage collaboration and positive change in not only our students and clients but also in our team. Nerding out is also highly encouraged.

Responsibilities
Train in-person or online boot camp students, the next generation of data scientists, on a wide range of topics ranging from statistics, probability, SQL, R/python coding, data analysis, machine learning, deep learning, and big data, etc.
Develop, evaluate, and maintain cutting-edge technical content for training experiences relevant to audiences with a diverse set of educational backgrounds and industry experience.
Tailoring teaching content for both corporate and client training.
Guide and mentor our students inside and outside of the classroom for their industry-ready projects. Help to orient our students’ learning toward the target industries.
Lead by example as a data scientist, to be an excellent role model for our industry-ready students.
Cooperate with marketing/admission teams by participating in the student enrollment/admission procedure and by developing relevant content for them.
Participate in periodic training workshops to sharpen the relevant skill-sets.
About You
Minimum of a Master’s Degree in a Quantitative Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics-related field; Computer Science and Statistics preferred.
Proficiency in statistical computing/machine learning and/or programming in R and/or Python.
Experience/extensive knowledge in R or Python data analysis.
Teaching experience in undergraduate or graduate level coursework in STEM required.
Demonstrated experience/knowledge of Statistics and Machine Learning from both theoretical and applied perspectives.
Experience in developing a curriculum or providing training in a client-facing endeavor.
A good sense of the relevance of academic data science to industrial applications.
Forward thinking with a strong growth mentality, i.e. constantly strengthening yourself on all fronts relevant to the growth of our school.
Passionate about teaching and helping your students succeed in their careers.
A team player who can multitask if necessary and can step up to new challenges in a growing company.
Perks
Competitive salary, adjustable hours, and flexible vacation policy.
Benefits include 401k retirement plan and medical, dental, vision insurances.
Opportunity to train, research, and learn in the field of data science on-the-job; a chance to interact with active data science communities through conferences, Meetup events, etc.
Completely stocked snack pantry.
High-quality computational equipment.

Company Name:
NTT Global Data Centers Americas, Inc
4.8
Job Description:
POSITION SUMMARY: BASIC FUNCTION

Provide customer service, troubleshooting, as well as incident escalation for all users contacting the 24 x 7 x 365 NOC environment and act as escalation point for NOC Technician L1. Regular, predictable attendance is essential for satisfactory performance.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Provides corporate desktop support services including Laptop Imaging, Network Printer Support, User account administration and other Hardware, Software, Telecom, and Communication services with support from Senior Tier 1 or Tier 2 Operations team members
Maintains desktop inventory, asset tracking.
Maintains desktop software license management and inventory control.
Handles provisioning of new systems as justified.
Surplus desktop assets at end-of useful life.
Maintains printer and copier stocking, maintenance and supplies.
Handles cell phone provisioning, tracking, and billing analysis.
Supports BYOD policy and procedures
Processes all support requests within SLA and following procedural requirements.
Performs initial investigation and/or troubleshooting of system and network issues to determine root.
Thoroughly documents steps taken to resolve incidents.
Escalates appropriate requests to ensure timely resolution.
Prepares and delivers standard scheduled reports .
Manages event monitoring tools and ticket queue to resolve operation tickets within SLA parameters.
Processes Hands and Eye requests as required i.e. Tape Rotation, Rack and Stack of equipment, inventory hardware, power cycle devices, patch cable install/removal Admin Inventory Hardware.
Performs initial investigation and/or troubleshooting of system and network issues to determine root cause and resolution. Escalates as required to meet target timelines.
Acts as point of contact for client and management escalations.
Develops and documents support procedures.
Implements and maintains data center infrastructure with general support of a Tier 2 Operations Engineer.
Participates in training and mentoring of NOC Technician L1.
Performs other duties as assigned.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES
Strong problem solving skills
Good troubleshooting skills
Outstanding customer service skills
Keen analytical and structured approach to problem solving
Excellent documentation skills
Dedication to customer satisfaction
Strong leadership skills
Ability to multi-task
Ability to accommodate flexible work schedules
Proven ability to work independently
Ability to work well in a team environment
Working knowledge of the following industry standard technologies is required for this role:
Windows OS (All)
Active Directory
Exchange, Outlook, Office
Microsoft Networking
TCP/IP
DNS
Static HTML
Internet and email apps
Remote access
VPN
Wireless
Anti-virus applications
Computer hardware
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE
High school diploma or GED required.
One to two years of college required or equivalent work experience. Bachelor degree preferred.
A + & Network + Certification preferred
3 to 5 years in a 24X7 Network Operations Control center/end user support role with demonstrated strong customer service delivery skills
Minimum 3 to 4 years of comprehensive knowledge required in at least one of the following areas:
Desktop Application support within all current MS Windows OS
Windows desktop management and security with Antivirus, anti-malware, patch deployment and management, and troubleshooting application conflicts.
Network hardware and software w/an emphasis on cabling and circuit provisioning in a shared data center environment
Microsoft Windows such as Windows 7 & 8 and Server 2008 & 2012
Maintain printers, print servers, printer driver management
Types a minimum of 35wpm.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
Able to climb ladders and work on raised platforms.
Able to hear and speak into a telephone and 2-way radio.
Ability to distinguish colors on wiring and cables to ensure safety protocols are followed.
Ability to work in confined spaces.
Requires ability to lift and carry objects weighing up to 50 pounds.
Requires the ability to kneel, stand, walk great distances, climb stairs/ladders
Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate any required computer keyboard, mouse, and other technical instruments.
Able to hear and speak into a telephone and 2 way radio/ear bud.
WORK CONDITIONS
Typical data center work environment with varying temperatures and loud noises
Extensive daily usage of a computer or workstation
Work on site; no telecommuting
SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS
May be required to work second and third shifts on occasion, or as scheduled
Must be comfortable working in a highly critical, fast paced environment with shifting priorities
Must possess a current, valid state-issued driver’s license

About Us

Just as the field of Data Science is growing and ever-changing, so is our team: we’re on the hunt for talented instructors who are passionate about what they do and want to make a difference in the education of the world’s up-and-coming data scientists — our students.

The NYC Data Science Academy prides itself on housing the most comprehensive 12-week intensive boot camp in data science methodologies, providing theoretical, practical, and hands-on knowledge to our scholars. We nurture top talents in the industrial & academic world into industry-ready data scientists, by equipping them with knowledge, technical skills, and insights aiming at maximal impacts to the business world. We adapt faster than the quickest machine learning algorithms out there — with content that reflects research and application in the growing industry and teaching expertise which goes beyond extraordinary.

That’s where you come in.

From our part-time weekend/evening classes to our part-time online and full-time in-person boot camps, our courses are both designed in-house and taught by our robust team of data scientists and engineers. Instructors have the opportunity of taking part in corporate training and consulting client projects, building both data science and big data solutions. We encourage collaboration and positive change in not only our students and clients but also in our team. Nerding out is also highly encouraged.

Responsibilities
Train in-person or online boot camp students, the next generation of data scientists, on a wide range of topics ranging from statistics, probability, SQL, R/python coding, data analysis, machine learning, deep learning, and big data, etc. Topics in Big Data to include:
Hadoop and MapReduce, HDFS, Hive
Apache Hive
Spark
Spark SQL
Spark Machine Learning
Docker
Develop, evaluate, and maintain cutting-edge technical content for training experiences relevant to audiences with a diverse set of educational backgrounds and industry experience.
Tailoring teaching content for both corporate and client training.
Guide and mentor our students inside and outside of the classroom for their industry-ready projects. Help to orient our students’ learning toward the target industries.
Lead by example as a data scientist, to be an excellent role model for our industry-ready students.
Cooperate with marketing/admission teams by participating in the student enrollment/admission procedure and by developing relevant content for them.
Participate in periodic training workshops to sharpen the relevant skill-sets.
About You
Minimum of a Master’s Degree in a Quantitative Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics-related field; Computer Science and Statistics preferred.
Proficiency in statistical computing/machine learning and/or programming in R and/or Python.
Experience/extensive knowledge in R or Python data analysis.
Teaching experience in undergraduate or graduate level coursework in STEM required.
Demonstrated experience/knowledge of Statistics and Machine Learning from both theoretical and applied perspectives.
Experience in developing a curriculum or providing training in a client-facing endeavor.
A good sense of the relevance of academic data science to industrial applications.
Forward thinking with a strong growth mentality, i.e. constantly strengthening yourself on all fronts relevant to the growth of our school.
Passionate about teaching and helping your students succeed in their careers.
A team player who can multitask if necessary and can step up to new challenges in a growing company.
Perks
Competitive salary, adjustable hours, and flexible vacation policy.
Benefits include 401k retirement plan and medical, dental, vision insurances.
Opportunity to train, research, and learn in the field of data science on-the-job; a chance to interact with active data science communities through conferences, Meetup events, etc.
Completely stocked snack pantry.
High-quality computational equipment.

The Building Maintenance Technician (BMT) is responsible for responding to and resolving all facilities building maintenance requests. Building maintenance tasks may include, but are not limited to: plumbing, carpentry, electrical, lighting, heating, air-conditioning (HVAC), and general clean-up or maintenance to support the building needs, as required. This position will also provide escorting for contractors providing services in the building and the data center, as requested.
Responsibilities
Answer and respond to all mechanical, electrical, and plumbing-related calls from customers, contractors, and management.
Address and correct issues promptly, and properly communicate any on-going or severe issues to the appropriate chain of command
Record all maintenance tasks via the appropriate system, resolve tickets in the system when work is complete
Inspect interior and exterior building structures to determine functional systems and detect malfunctions and needed repair making notes and recommendations to management
Perform minor electrical maintenance to include but not be limited to replacement or repair of fixtures (e.g. wall switches and outlets, incandescent and fluorescent bulbs and tubes, ballast, sockets, fuses, minor appliances, cords, etc.) using appropriate hand, power and specialty tools
Perform minor plumbing maintenance (e.g. replacement or repair of leaks in drains and faucets, unclogging of drains, trenching and laying new lines, replacing drain hoses on washers and similar devices, etc.)
Reconfigure, install, position, and remount modular offices and space (e.g. furniture, wall panels, work surfaces, storage bins, lighting, file cabinets, etc.) to accommodate user needs and maximize office space using various hand, power and specialty tools, dollies and hand trucks
Evaluate, prepare, and paint structures and equipment (e.g. walls, refrigerators, evaporative coolers, floors, roofs, doors, restroom facilities, etc.) to preserve wood and metal parts from corrosion and maintain a safe, comfortable working environment using painting equipment and related tools (e.g. sprayers, rollers, brushes, thinners, etc.)
Perform preventative maintenance work on building electrical, mechanical, and plumbing equipment supporting the building office space
Assist with the development, revision, and execution preventive maintenance procedures, and perform quality control reviews to ensure accuracy, clarity, and continual improvement
Order parts, as needed, to support building maintenance needs, and maintain required documents and record of inventory
Assist with planning and coordination of all large-scale projects required to address building issues
Maintain accurate building data including, rounds, PM work orders, change management, etc.
Manage assigned workflow tasks in order to provide timely turnaround
Escort and work effectively with outside contractors, ensure they are abiding by critical facility work rules
Complete facility rounds at the beginning of each shift to ensure building and grounds upkeep
Follow T5 data center corporate policies and procedures
Adhere to all federal, state, and local safety laws
Complete other such duties consistent with your role as you may be assigned by T5FM management
Education or Equivalent Experience
High school degree or GED, preferred
Two years working experience in facility maintenance
Basic understanding of electrical, plumbing and carpentry, required
Electrical or mechanical licensure, preferred
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities, and Competencies
Able to follow instructions, respond to management direction, and volunteer readily when asked, required
Able to handle changing needs and priorities accurately and professionally, required
Able to work proficiently and safely with hand tools and power tools, required
Has strong customer service skills, able to work with all a range of personalities and individuals, required
Has exceptional listening skills, required
Displays empathy and understanding of customer needs, required
Has a “can-do” customer service attitude, is conscientious, and takes personal pride in their work, required
Physical Requirements
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. These physical tasks may be required on an emergency basis, meaning performed by the BMT alone, without notice, and on an immediate basis to meet urgent facility operations requirements and standards at a site where frequently no other personnel are available.
Ability to stand, walk, sit, climb, and balance
Ability to stoop, kneel, crouch and crawl using both arms and legs
Ability to reach, grasp, push, pull, handle, feel, and type with both hands and arms
Ability to smell, talk and hear
Ability to see at close and distance ranges and the ability to see and correctly distinguish color
Ability to lift equipment in small spaces without mechanical assistance, weighing up to 100 pounds
Ability to work inside and outside

At PitchBook we work to provide global professionals with comprehensive data on the entire venture capital, private equity and M&A landscape so they can discover and execute opportunities with confidence. About the Role:

Customers are King! Each and every day the Customer Success Team works to ensure that are clients are maximizing the value they are receiving from PitchBook. Onboarding, training, support, business development and renewals are handled by the Customer Success team. Account Managers work to drive value that leads to expansion, renewals and customer satisfaction. Works collaboratively with a designated Customer Success Manager to strategize on account retention and growth opportunities
Goes above and beyond to ensure customer satisfaction with quarterly business reviews and continual product education
Has an appreciation for the PE / VC marketplace and the ability to learn, comprehend, and demonstrate why and how each of our client types engages with our product and our data

At least two (2) years of sales or account management experience
Experience with Salesforce or other CRMs to forecast sales and maintain updated records of client interactions
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with a keen eye for detail
