Job Summary

The Account Managemer serves a critical function within the Customer Success Team to establish partnerships with existing and emerging Fortune 5000 companies. Through relationships and deep account knowledge, the Account Management Executive brings higher value to their customers, helping them work smarter through Infutor's product and service solutions.

We're looking for an entrepreneurial account management professional, someone who is adept at seeing a market opportunity. The right fit for us will have strong knowledge about social media advertising, programmatic advertising, search advertising, Mobile Ad IDs (MAIDs), cookies, hashed emails, audience creation, DSPs, DMPs, CDPs and a host of other 3 and 4 letter acronyms to create great experiences for both online consumers and brands.

You will work closely with technology, product and C-Suite leaders across the MarTech & AdTech ecosystem on maintaining, growing and servicing these accounts with the highest degree of professional and subject matter expertise.

We are looking for someone to drive the relationships within MarTech/AdTech for an emerging product line that will resonate at the moment a consumer identity is deployed by our clients. In our view, its an omni-channel engagement world, one where consumer identity management can empower companies to create contextually aware micro-moments.

This person hired to this role may be based out of our Oakbrook Terrace HQ or new Chicago Loop Office. Note, relocation is not provided. Please apply only to your preferred location.

Responsibilities and Duties

The Account Manager is responsible for managing his/her client relationships, as well as developing new business from existing clients. This position reports to the VP of Client Engagement, and requires periodic travel to client sites, industry conferences, and to attend meetings/training.

As an Account Manager, your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:
Consultative Selling
Develop deep account relationships with executive-level and operational contacts and document needs and organizational priorities; Earn the role of trusted adviser by demonstrating a thorough understanding of Infutors solutions and matching these solutions to client needs.
Use business intelligence and account knowledge to build specific account strategies to increase market share; create compelling business cases to cross-sell other core Infutor products into the account.
Outline benefits of capabilities against critical business issues; be able to articulate the value proposition and gain commitments.
Possess a thorough understanding of competitors products and services and can distinguish us from the competition; make recommendations for new marketing or product opportunities.
Maintain knowledge and awareness of key industry trends and best practices.
Strategy & Sales Planning
Quota carrying position; provide forecast precision by reviewing opportunities, anticipated obstacles, and implementation timelines.
Create account management plans for strategic accounts, including workflow and business assessments to identify opportunities which create high impact and return on investment for the account base through the increased use of Infutor solutions.
Manage contracts, as well as volume analysis and trending, renewals, pricing, and all elements related to client satisfaction and retention to ensure revenue growth
Manage accounts and contacts through Salesforce.com, record contact and maintain high quality content.
Teamwork & Collaboration
Collaborate with internal marketing, analytics, and technology teams to communicate requirements and opportunities for this channel and targeted accounts.
Effectively coordinate internal resources to support solution design, proposal development, pricing, contract negotiations, and implementation of solutions.
Provide forecast precision by reviewing opportunities, anticipated obstacles, and implementation timelines.
Communicate business intelligence and account knowledge to internal support teams to foster product innovation, enhance marketing effectiveness, and capture revenue opportunities.

Develops client relationships throughout the organization in each pertinent area of the business in collaboration with delivery leaders.

Stays well-informed on industry changes, participates where possible in professional organizations directly involved with our prime markets, and continually works to improve sales techniques and knowledge.

Actively participates in weekly, monthly, and quarterly Sales meetings and functions, either in person or via conference call.

Actively pursues and participates in industry events, training opportunities, and other additional promotional and expertise gathering initiatives.

Regular, predictable attendance is essential for satisfactory performance.

Strong contract negotiation skills.

Team selling approach utilizing multiple departments to execute large sales opportunities.

Frequent travel to client sites.

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS

Valid driver’s license and car insurance.

Experience with Database (Postgres/MySQL)
Networking fundamentals (subnets, netmasks, gateways, and network boundaries)
Basic knowledge of DNS, DHCP, LDAP, and HTTP protocols
Basic server hardware troubleshooting
Experience with Infoblox DDI
Update the DNS/DHCP/IPAM infrastructure as needed.
Update diagrams for DDI architecture using Microsoft Visio
Troubleshoot DDI issues with multiple teams
Perform DDI configuration using both GUI and CLI commands
Submit and respond to tickets using a central ticketing system such as ServiceNow

Complete understanding and wide application of technical principles, theories and concepts in DNS,
DHCP & IP Address Management system implementation.
Must have an understanding of DHCP and DNS interaction with servers and client systems.
Senior-level experience with DDI GUI configuration and CLI commands (VitalQIP, InfoBlox & Bluecat)
Experience using a central ticketing system such as ServiceNow
Experience using the Microsoft Office Suite
Experience using Microsoft Visio for drawings
Experience following a change management system to submit and perform changes
Use of a network monitoring system to alert via SNMP on device failures
Ability to use Wire Shark to obtain network traces and perform analysis
VitalQIP experience
Network troubleshooting experience
Postgres/MySQL experience
Must-Have:
4+ years of DNS, DHCP & IP Address Management system implementation experience
4+ years of DDI GUI configuration and CLI commands (VitalQIP, InfoBlox & Bluecat)
4+ years of Postgres/MySQL experience

POSITION SUMMARY: BASIC FUNCTION

The Client Executive is responsible for RagingWire products and service sales activities such as developing and managing key strategic accounts and internal resources to facilitate the sales process, establishing and maintaining effective communications with appropriate executives and management to ensure proper sensitivity to sales needs, and maximizing sales revenue to meet company objectives.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Develops and manages territory coverage and account strategy plans; executes against sales objectives, margin goals, and overall business strategy.

Develops client relationships throughout the organization in each pertinent area of the business in collaboration with delivery leaders.

Maintains Salesforce.com and client interaction records.

Executes sales based on specific marketing programs.

Participates in corporate-wide sales activities including focused sales campaigns.

Presents account reviews with team to identify and target practice area specific opportunities.

Share successes and ideas with team.

Is accountable for meeting or exceeding assigned sales objectives and monthly revenue quotas.

Conducts follow-up service calls to all accounts on a regular basis.

Prepares and delivers documents such as RFP's, SOW's, and MSA's accurately and timely.

Maintains an accurate sales pipeline within our CRM system (and/or other internal systems) and creates forecasts comparing revenue sold compared to quota goals.

Stays well-informed on industry changes, participates where possible in professional organizations directly involved with our prime markets, and continually works to improve sales techniques and knowledge.

Actively participates in weekly, monthly, and quarterly Sales meetings and functions, either in person or via conference call.

Actively pursues and participates in industry events, training opportunities, and other additional promotional and expertise gathering initiatives.

Regular, predictable attendance is essential for satisfactory performance.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES

Solid proficiency to use the MS Office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), Salesforce.com, and sharepoint In-depth data center knowledge.

Strong contract negotiation skills.

Excellent communication (verbal, written and presentation) and leadership skills required.

Senior level client relationship skills including experience in negotiations and articulating complex solutions and benefits.

Prior experience and continued use of strategic selling practices.

Team selling approach utilizing multiple departments to execute large sales opportunities.

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE

Bachelor’s Degree required or equivalent experience usually obtained with 5-7 years directly related experience.

A minimum of 5 years’ experience in technical and solutions sales, with demonstrated abilities managing Fortune 1000 clients.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Ability to travel locally or nationally to client sites and meet with clients.

Ability to lift and carry up to 30 lbs.

Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate any required to operate vehicle, computer keyboard, mouse, and other technical instruments.

Close visual work on a computer terminal.

WORK CONDITIONS

Typical office environment with extensive daily usage of a computer or workstation.

Frequent travel to client sites.

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS

May require being on call periodically and working outside traditional business hours.

Valid driver’s license and car insurance.

Req ID: 94138

NTT DATA Services strives to hire exceptional, innovative and passionate individuals who want to grow with us. If you want to be part of an inclusive, adaptable, and forward-thinking organization, apply now.

We are currently seeking a Sr. Solution Architect - E2E Data Center / Cloud Modernization to join our team in McLean, Virginia (US-VA), United States (US).

Job Responsibilities:

NTT DATA Services is searching for a Public-Sector Sr. Solution Architect whose primary responsibility will be to collaborate with the Technical Practices in the pursuit of new business contracts. Their charter will be to align client requirements and position NTT DATA Services to win new business engagements by leading all technology solutions development.

This senior-level IT leader is expected to provide the vision and strategy to develop scalable repeatable processes and solutions in complex Public Sector environments, enhancing the company's competitiveness and to smoothly integrate existing service offerings into new deals.

We are seeking a high impact player with a proven record of putting together solutions ranging from project based deliverables to structured, long-term technology outsourcing deals in the $10M up to $1B range, coupled with broad knowledge that spans a wide range of application and infrastructure capabilities and their respective cost structures. This includes how these capabilities must be assembled into an operational delivery model that is both financially and technically sound. In addition, this business development specialist must have worked on deals involving third party consulting companies that advise on outsourcing of information technology.

Excellent interpersonal communication skills are a must with an emphasis on sound presentation abilities. This person must have solid executive presence as this role will require frequent contact with executives, internal and on client sites. This includes the ability to immediately establish and manage critical customer relationships at the Executive level, including technical buyers and key project stakeholders.

Sound financial and business acumen are essential, as the role will require the ability to manage, interpret and develop financial models and to respond appropriately to new business cycles across the scope of service offerings.

We are seeking a skilled negotiator; an individual who is able to craft and articulate how the value of the benefits of the "solution" outweigh the client's objections and come to a comfortable purchase decision that delivers both tangible business results to the client and a profitable engagement for NTT DATA Services.

Required Skills and Experience:

Minimum of ten plus (10+) years of progressive / successful consultative business development solutions experience. Proven track-record of success in a senior IT position. The preferred experience base will have been gained in Information Technology Outsourcing (ITO) with Federal and State & Local customers.

Must possess a demonstrated track-record of structuring and winning long-term deals in the $10M to $1B range. This includes being able to understand the customer’s challenges to develop a blended-combination of technology and business solutions encompassing financial

models, service definitions, service level expectations and timeframes to help them meet their mission. This will be reflected by a background of leadership in the pursuit and closure of multi-year ITO and/or BPO services agreements.

Broad knowledge that spans a wide range of capabilities and their respective cost structures in the areas of managed services, end-to-end data center outsourcing, cloud advisory, and cloud transformation. Specific skills and experience in both AWS and Microsoft Azure are required. Knowledge of third-party tools as well as ITIL, Agile, SAFe, and DevSecOps methodologies is desired. This includes how these capabilities must be assembled into an operational delivery model that is both financially and technically sound.

Must understand the "numbers" and be able to drill down into the details and make the business case from financial perspective in developing accurate and standardized costing (pricing models) for delivery solutions. This will be supported by "hands-on" experience in managing, interpreting and executing balance sheets. Excellent planning and organizational skills-will bring the ability to respond appropriately to new business cycles across the scope of service offerings.

Strong executive presence and professional image. Exceptional communication skills (written and verbal). Ability to develop executive level (value-based) conversations with senior level decision makers (CEO, COO, CFO, CIO, etc.) and put together, or deliver, value-based proposals to clients in the targeted industry sectors.

A team player; someone comfortable working in a highly collaborative, team-oriented culture. Technical proposal writing skills a must. Must have the ability to effectively utilize and lead/direct Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) during the solutions development and sales pursuit process. Must be action and results-oriented - a "take-charge" leader with strong business case development and closing skills.

Must be willing to travel as business needs dictate.

We are currently seeking aBusiness / ETL Test Analyst to join our team inPhoenix, Arizona.

NTT DATA Services is committed to improving patient outcomes by creating efficiencies across the healthcare ecosystem. A recognized leader in the healthcare space, the company delivers targeted segment solutions including patient engagement, predictive analytics, healthcare cloud hosting, integration and interoperability, clinical and claims application implementation, revenue cycle management and policy administration, in addition to core managed infrastructure, application and business process services. Clients include more than 1,800 hospitals, 2,200 long-term care facilities, 225 acute care facilities, 43,000 clinicians, 1,000 physician practices and 50 insurance providers in support of 65 million policy holders.

The individual will be responsible for the following:
Perform Business Analyst and Test Analyst functions for Data Warehouse project
Understand the existing data warehouse/databases, inbound data files and data ingestion process
Work with client stakeholders to capture business requirements for building data warehouse, data marts, reports and dashboards
Apply Healthcare knowledge to correctly understand the data, KPIs and metrics for reporting
Design, plan and execute product testing including functional testing, system integration testing, regression testing and performance testing for an analytics product including data visualizations and ETL
Estimate, plan and execute testing activities for analytics content
Design, write and execute effective manual and automated test cases and create test data as needed
Discover, reproduce, prioritize, retest and clearly document system defects
Develop, update and maintain relevant test metric reporting
Perform test coverage analysis and requirements tracing. Actively participate with the team in software requirements, design and code reviews to provide early and continuous feedback
Work with team to continually improve test processes and practices based on inspection, adaption of previous iterations and to ensure adherence to process, tools and metrics standards within the project team
Understand data flow and test strategy for ETL and visualization testing
Write advanced SQL queries for ETL/data warehousing/visualization testing
Possess ability to research issues and improve processes
Develop and deliver the artifacts in Agile methodology
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor/Master of Computer Application or equivalent engineering / IT degree from an accredited University
Minimum of 3 years of experience in Data warehouse (DW) testing, understanding DW testing requirements and develop test cases to assure that the data that has been loaded from a source to destination after business transformation is accurate
Minimum of 3 years domain knowledge of Healthcare, specifically Payer domain
Preferred Skills
Strong knowledge of SQL and SQL Server
Experience in ETL and data warehousing testing and BI reporting tool testing
Strong exposure to Software Testing tools like ALM (Quality Center), JIRA
In-depth experience and demonstrated proficiency with QA methodology, process and deliverables
Expertise required in source to target data testing, data completeness testing, ETL job setup and validations
Knowledge of test planning activities & tools, test environment setup methods, test scripting methods and tools
Knowledge of data modelling, data warehousing and visualization concepts
Knowledge in tools like Visual Studio, VSTS (Visual Studio Team Services), TFS (Team Foundation Server)/Azure DevOps
Familiarity with Agile methodology for project
Experience of working with teams across other geographies in onshore/offshore model
Good understanding of Membership, Claims, Pharmacy orders
Ability to adapt quickly to an existing, complex environment and learn new concepts / software technologies as needs arise
Adaptable and flexible meet demands, being relentless and passionate to get the job done
Strong work prioritization, planning and organizational skills.

Domino has an ambitious vision for data science and machine learning. Our mission is to help the world run on models. Our platform is used by data science teams to accelerate research, increase collaboration, and rapidly deploy predictive models. As a Staff Software Engineer at Domino you will guide architectural and engineering direction and empower engineers to solve our most technical challenges. Lead and participate in critical technical, design, and product discussions with leaders across the organization and company

POSITION SUMMARY: BASIC FUNCTION

The Senior Product Manager, Colocation is responsible for all aspects of planning, defining, creating, launching, and refining products and services at NTT Global Data Centers Americas, with emphasis around colocation. This position maintains a close relationship with the market (customers, prospects, thought leaders and competitors) and drives growth and profitability for NTT. The Senior Product Manager, Colocation has a unique blend of business and technical savvy, a big-picture vision, and the drive to make that vision a reality.

This role is cross departmental and requires successful communications with all areas of the company;
Executives - to disseminate the business strategy
Engineering - to define and refine detailed product requirements
Construction to understand schedules and building constraints
Marketing - to define a go-to-market strategy, articulating positioning, key benefits, target customers and market verticals

I.T. - to ensure additional data center services are positioned and priced to minimize confusion and maximize adoption / customer penetration

Specifies market requirements for current and future datacenter locations, by conducting market research supported by on-going visits to customers and non-customers.

Leads efforts to increase revenue or reduce costs associated with products / services.
Develops product forecasts, pricing, and operational models.

Tracks and maintains performance metrics for new products and markets.

Serves as an industry thought leader and presents the company vision at industry events.
Drives projects through NTT Global Data Centers America?s Technology Steering Committee and reports weekly on product roadmap and project status.
Leads efforts to increase revenue and profits or reduce costs associated products, and develops product forecasts, pricing, and operational model.
Tracks and maintains performance metrics for new product and service launches.
Participates in various Sales Support activities, including product and services training, seminars and documentation, and pre and post sales customer visits.
Interacts with all RagingWire departments, vendors, partners, contractors and clients.
Regular attendance is essential for satisfactory performance.

Strong communication and presentation skills, with formal public speaking and presentation training.
Ability to create a concise business plan ? and present that plan to others
Able to be highly confidential.
Proficient with computers to include the utilization of Microsoft programs such as Word, Excel, Power Point and Outlook.
Strong analytical skills ? ability to calculate and articulate ROI of products and projects.
Ability to negotiate compromises between conflicting priorities.
Able to work in a team environment.
Manages stress and/or fast pace effectively.
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
Ability to communicate with all areas of the company.
Familiarity with Pragmatic Marketing framework
Detailed understanding of the Product Lifecycle
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE

Launching new products and services.

We are currently seeking a IT Security Manager - Addison, TX to join our team in Plano, Texas (US-TX), United States (US).

The NTT DATA Services Information Security Manager (ISM) oversees and coordinates the information security services that NTT DATA provides to the customer. This is an individual contributor role in which the ISM acts as a trusted information security partner with the customer and works collaboratively to understand, anticipate and recommend risk mitigation while promoting the overall information security protection for the customer's information assets. You will partner with the client to align information security with the customer's business strategy, security policies and regulatory and compliance requirements resulting in increased protection and reduced risk.

**This position requires working onsite daily at our client's office in Addison, TX.

Responsibilities:
Ensure the delivery of information security services to the customer is in compliance with the contract and any applicable standards and regulatory requirements
Collaborate with the client in the definition and implementation of information security policies, strategies, procedures and configurations in order to ensure confidentiality, integrity and availability of client's environment and data
Participate with the customer in the strategic design process to translate security and business requirements into technologies, processes and systems
Evaluate new / emerging security products and technologies and make recommendations to customer leadership in regards to the security impact and value to the organization
Participate in internal and external audits for the customer (e.g., PCI, SOX) and coordinate information security services activities to support the audit (i.e., defining, gathering artifacts, etc.)
Manage and drive remediation efforts related to information security; remediation may be from incidents, penetration tests, vulnerability scans, internal/external audits and Critical Practice Assessments
Identify information security weaknesses or potential gaps in the customer's current environment and work with the customer to bring information security operations up to standards
Participate and represent IT Security in Delivery/Operational meetings; conduct an information security operational review meeting with account (e.g., Customer Delivery Executive) and customer (e.g., CISO) key stakeholders with topics including overall information security status and performance
Review service management reports to ensure tickets (i.e., incidents, problems, requests, changes) related to information security, are being acknowledged, worked and Service Level Agreements are met; provide direction on ticket remediation and ensure remediation is complete
Conduct an ongoing security awareness program for NTT DATA personnel supporting the customer ensuring individuals understand and are compliant with the relevant information security obligations in support of the customer including security topics that provide guidance on customer security policies and supporting documentation and procedures
Cultivate trusted partner relationships with account and customer; keep consistent and open dialogue to uncover issues, challenges, risks
Maintain an information security strategy (forward looking roadmap), for your customer, aligning services / portfolio components to the strategy
Interact with a broad cross-section of personnel to explain and enforce security measures
Monitor the threat landscape and make timely adjustments and/or recommendations to reduce risk

Basic Requirements:
8+ years of information security experience and/or IT risk management experience with a focus on security, performance, and reliability
Experience with security protocols, cryptography, authentication, authorization, and security
Experience with multi-factor authentication, single sign-on, identity management or related technologies
Experience with network security technologies and architectures such as firewalls, IDS/IPS, DMZ architecture, Content filtering, etc.
Experience with SIEM technologies (i.e., architecture, logging, event correlation, incident response, etc.)
Experience with standards and regulations impacting information security and information security internal & external audits (i.e. SOX, PCI, etc.)

Preferences:
At least one of the following certifications: CISSP, CISM, SSCP, CEH, or CSSLP
Undergraduate or graduate degree
Security/Consulting industry experience working in a customer facing role with customer relationship management experience

Job Description:
About Us


Simon Data was founded in 2015 by a team of successful serial entrepreneurs. We are an enterprise customer data platform that empowers marketers to create personalized data-driven experiences for the customers. We're scrappy problem solvers who believe in tackling big challenges with disruptive thinking and giving our customers the support they need to deliver great next-generation experiences at scale.

Simon Data is a data-first customer experience orchestration platform, designed to disrupt the marketing technology and marketing cloud category. Simon's platform empowers businesses to use enterprise-scale data and machine learning to power customer communications across every channel. Our unique approach allows brands to develop one-to-one relationships with their customers without building a bespoke in-house data infrastructure.

At Simon, we firmly believe that business success starts and ends with people. We all do our best work when we are surrounded by other friendly top performers who want to succeed together. This attitude is core to our values. When you trust your team, invest in their development, and give them ownership, great things happen.

The Role


Do you find elegance architecting a well-structured user interface? As a senior front-end engineer at Simon, you'll join the effort to push the boundaries by enabling our customers to get the most out of our products. Our clients rely on Simon to engage with hundreds of millions of customers -- sending over billions of messages annually. Successful engineers have a keen eye for optimization and have deep knowledge in delivering robust, usable, delightful web applications. We value ownership and creativity. Join us on our journey to deliver awesome products!

You'll be joining a team with core values of Simplicity, Generosity, Execution, and Openness. We move quickly (multiple deploys throughout the day) and constantly work to reduce waste as well as structure ourselves around the most important goals for the business. Our engineering team currently comprises roughly 50 engineers of diverse backgrounds and skill sets.

What you'll do
Lead development efforts to produce a cohesive, powerful user experience in our web application
Continuously look for ways to improve last-mile performance
Work to coordinate and evolve front-end development efforts
Drive the evolution of our front-end stack onto modern, widely used tools like TypeScript, React Hooks, and GraphQL!
Help build a scalable and maintainable frontend development process by e.g. contributing to our design system and component library.
Participate in team-wide discussions ranging from architecture to developer productivity to security to the best IDE
Work with the team to promote our technical brand through chipping in with Open Source Software and promoting and sharing it at conferences locally and nationwide
Participate in our mentorship program, whether that's helping your coworkers expand their skill set or learning from them to expand your own
Qualifications
7+ years of front-end software development experience designing, deploying, and owning several substantive projects with company-wide impact
Consistent record working with various functional owners in your company (spanning product management, program management, as well as Dev/Tech Ops)
Deep understanding and expertise with React, TypeScript, and GraphQL
Preferred fluency with at least one mainstream programming language (JavaScript, Python, Java, Scala, C#, Ruby, etc.)
Diversity


We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer open to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, Veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Domino has an ambitious vision for data science and machine learning. Our platform helps data science teams accelerate research, increase collaboration, and rapidly deploy predictive models. Our customers are the most sophisticated analytical organizations in the world, including Dell, Red Hat, Gap, Bristol-Myers Squibb, and Bayer.

Backed by Sequoia Capital, Zetta Venture Partners, and Bloomberg Beta. Domino is at the epicenter of the data science revolution, helping companies build better cars, develop more effective medicine, or simply recommend the best song to play next.

Our platform is deployed across the full spectrum of scenarios from on-premise to cloud. Our clients rely on it for mission critical workloads. We use cutting edge technologies to ensure that each deployment is reliable, performant and cost effective, while allowing us to support a rapidly growing number of deployments with tight SLAs. Come help us push the envelope!

As a Staff Software Engineer within the Collaboration and Navigation Team, you'll be building features that allow Domino users to organize their work in discoverable ways. The Collaboration & Navigation Team is a new team within our organization and you'll be building it out from the ground up. You will guide architectural and engineering direction and empower engineers to solve our most technical challenges. While you'll spend half of your time writing code, you'll spend another quarter of your time working alongside product managers to drive the technical direction and architectural decisions needed to build and scale our product. The balance of your time is as a coach, guiding and developing engineers by setting strong examples, reviewing their code and helping develop their skills.

Responsibilities
Craft durable, well-tested code with an unwavering commitment to product quality
Build products, systems, and services that have immediate impact on our customers
Partner closely with product managers, designers, and engineers to define your team's vision and roadmap by thoroughly understanding your customers' needs
Coach and develop engineers, cultivating pragmatic engineering decision-making, and leveraging your technical expertise to constantly raise the bar
Lead and participate in critical technical, design, and product discussions with leaders across the organization and company
Qualifications
Minimum of 8 years experience in software engineering
Prior experience in a technical lead role, with responsibility for architectural decisions and the development of software engineers
Prior experience with enterprise software
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field involving coding or equivalent technical experience

At Sisu, we're building a software platform that empowers people to make better decisions using data. Based on years of cutting-edge data systems research at Stanford, the platform provides actionable insights to businesses from their data. Sisu integrates with modern data warehouses, which provide a streaming, structured view of key business metrics and their relationships with first-party organizational data. We draw on novel techniques from data mining, statistical analysis, and machine learning to produce these insights and deliver them through an elegant, modern web interface.

Sisu Data is seeking a Data Solutions Engineer as part of the dynamic and strategic go-to-market team to help customers tackle critical ETL and data pipelining problems. Externally, you'll get exposure to senior leadership at a variety of companies across a variety of industries, from retail to healthcare to energy, in helping guide their decision-making with data. On our dynamic, intellectually hungry, and delightfully quirky team, the number of opportunities is unbounded.
What you’ll accomplish:
Create, maintain, and optimize data pipeline architecture internally and on behalf of our clients.
Recommend and assemble large, complex data sets that meet business and technical requirements for extracting value out of Sisu.
Help pave strategic roadmaps for how Sisu should approach data engineering (such as data ingestion and ETL process) and how Sisu should navigate data solutions for customers to receive maximum value from Sisu
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual data processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL on AWS (Redshift), Google Cloud Product (GCP), Snowflake, and Microsoft Azure.
Act as analytics liaison for a variety of accounts, interacting with C-level executives down to individual analysts, to bring value to a variety of industries and use cases.
Communicate feedback from customers’ data engineers to inform product strategy and feature work within the product and engineering teams.

What you'll need to be successful:

Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
Experience developing and maintaining data infrastructure for the organization
Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages, Python in particular, with large datasets as a plus.
Experience building and optimizing, including ETL/ETL process and tools, for data pipelines, architectures and data sets.
Strong analytics skills to disentangle and find usefulness in unstructured datasets.
Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
BA/BS or heavy coursework in quantitative field preferred.
This role is an excellent way for data engineers to get exposure to cutting edge technology and have customer-facing impact.

Sisu is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

About Us


Simon Data was founded in 2015 by a team of successful serial entrepreneurs. We are an enterprise customer data platform that empowers marketers to create personalized data-driven experiences for the customers. We're scrappy problem solvers who believe in tackling big challenges with disruptive thinking and giving our customers the support they need to deliver great next-generation experiences at scale.

Simon Data is a data-first customer experience orchestration platform, designed to disrupt the marketing technology and marketing cloud category. Simon's platform empowers businesses to use enterprise-scale data and machine learning to power customer communications across every channel. Our unique approach allows brands to develop one-to-one relationships with their customers without building a bespoke in-house data infrastructure.

At Simon, we firmly believe that business success starts and ends with people. We all do our best work when we are surrounded by other friendly top performers who want to succeed together. This attitude is core to our values. When you trust your team, invest in their development, and give them ownership, great things happen.

The Role


Great organizations are built on focus, cohesion, drive, and - of course - a winning product. At Simon, we've found a rapidly-expanding sweet spot in marketing software and are growing our team to take advantage of that opportunity.

The team at Simon is well-supported by a mature account development function, a forward-thinking go-to-market process, outstanding, hands-on client solutions team and a great customer base of savvy companies.

As a Sales Engineer, you'll be a catalyst to growing the top line in an essential new SaaS category at the intersection of data and marketing, backed by some of the best technologists in the world. This role will work cross-functionally with customers both pre- and post-sale as well as with our product function as the voice of our customer base.

What You'll Do
Diagnose challenges at the intersection of data and marketing facing CMOs, CTOs and VP-level leaders at F1000s and high-growth companies
Develop and deliver solutions architecture and product deployment against enterprise challenges, including client intake / assessment conversations, client workshops, business case formulation, and project planning
Work closely with Simon Data founders, Sales Executives, Client Solutions Managers and Product Managers to help shape product vision and go-to-market strategy
Participate in the commercialization strategy for a high-growth startup, backed by top investors
Assist prospective customers as they perform technical due diligence while also performing the same due diligence on behalf of Simon to assess client fit
Drive conversion of proof of concepts by assisting in presale solutioning and seeing the solution through implementation
Convey the voice of customers to a product and engineering team that is passionate about quality, staying ahead of the curve, teamwork, and supporting customer objectives
Qualifications
3-6+ years of data-driven marketing, sales engineering, management consulting, corporate strategy, or similar experience
Bachelor's degree (technical degree a plus)
Strong intuition for business, ability to strategically partner with clients
Experience thinking through complex data models and mapping business requirements to technical requirements and vice-a-versa
SQL expertise or similar relevant programming languages
Results oriented strategic thinker who is able to thrive in an unstructured and fast-paced environment
Thoughtful, curious and a problem solver
Experience as a top performer in previous roles
Superior emotional intelligence and interpersonal skills
Ability to quickly absorb and understand the dynamic MarTech landscape (prior knowledge a plus)
Ability to work independently to deliver outcomes, and collaborate with and across teams
Outstanding presentation skills and the ability to think on your feet

Job Title: Organizational Change Management Lead/Business Readiness Consultant

Job Description:
At Sisu, we're building a software platform that empowers people to make better decisions using data. Based on years of cutting-edge research at Stanford, Sisu enables users to quickly and comprehensively understand what’s driving their key metrics, so they never miss a window of opportunity to act.

Sisu is a fundamental rearchitecture of how users interact with data. Instead of relying on users to tell us what they want to see, as in traditional dashboarding systems, Sisu predicts users’ intent based on their metrics of interest, past behaviors, and other organizations like them. We take this kind of predictive analysis for granted in consumer applications (e.g., Netflix, Google, Facebook), but the hardest interface design and ranking problems lie in making private data found in everyday organizations actionable. The key problem we’re solving as a first step in this direction is to help identify what’s driving change in key metrics like revenue, retention, and churn among the enormous set of factors like user demographics, campaigns, and acquisition channels. To do so, we combine statistical analysis and machine learning at scale to provide users personalized, real-time diagnoses of changes in their metrics via an explainable, interpretable user interface.

As a Sr. Front End Engineer, you’ll be a subject matter expert shaping the future of Sisu’s product interface - a web application that our customers will rely on to “get the facts” to make data driven decisions. You’ll have the opportunity to work on technical challenges including developing our information architecture and solving unique problems, including how to represent statistical data in a digestible way to end users of various knowledge levels.
What you'll do:
Scale our Typescript / React / Redux front-end
Provide technical leadership to drive consensus based on empirical evidence
Navigate ambiguity with an open and curious cross-functional team
Understand our end user (data analyst) to eventually build a general use product
Craft a unique user experience that brings value to global brands. See Samsung and Upwork.
Actively partner with product and design to architect user empowering interfaces with performance and scalability in mind
Cultivate your design skills and transform Figma mocks into working prototypes
Shape the engineering culture through mentorship as our small, dynamic team grows
Actively participate in customer POCs to optimize customer experience and adoption.

About you:

Experience building user-facing products
Expertise with React and Redux
Expertise with Javascript or Typescript
Fluency in HTML, CSS, and ES6
Capable of coaching team members, by translating complex nuances related to the languages and libraries we use, in easy to understand terms.
Proficient in utilizing and designing REST and/or GraphQL APIs
Excellent communication skills for collaborating internally with partner teams and externally with our customers and end users
5+ years of relevant software engineering experience

We are currently seeking a Sr. Solution Architect - Low/No code solutioning expertise (Appian, Out Systems, Sales Force, MS Dyn to join our team in McLean, Virginia (US-VA), United States (US).

Job Responsibilities:

NTT DATA Services is searching for a Public-Sector Sr. Solution Architect whose primary responsibility will be to collaborate with the Technical Practices in the pursuit of new business contracts. Their charter will be to align client requirements and position NTT DATA Services to win new business engagements by leading all technology solutions development.

This senior-level IT leader is expected to provide the vision and strategy to develop scalable repeatable processes and solutions in complex Public Sector environments, enhancing the company's competitiveness and to smoothly integrate existing service offerings into new deals.

We are seeking a high impact player with a proven record of putting together solutions ranging from project based deliverables to structured, long-term technology outsourcing deals in the $10M up to $1B range, coupled with broad knowledge that spans a wide range of application and infrastructure capabilities and their respective cost structures. This includes how these capabilities must be assembled into an operational delivery model that is both financially and technically sound. In addition, this business development specialist must have worked on deals involving third party consulting companies that advise on outsourcing of information technology.

Excellent interpersonal communication skills are a must with an emphasis on sound presentation abilities. This person must have solid executive presence as this role will require frequent contact with executives, internal and on client sites. This includes the ability to immediately establish and manage critical customer relationships at the Executive level, including technical buyers and key project stakeholders.

Sound financial and business acumen are essential, as the role will require the ability to manage, interpret and develop financial models and to respond appropriately to new business cycles across the scope of service offerings.

We are seeking a skilled negotiator; an individual who is able to craft and articulate how the value of the benefits of the "solution" outweigh the client's objections and come to a comfortable purchase decision that delivers both tangible business results to the client and a profitable engagement for NTT DATA Services.

Required Skills and Experience:

Minimum of ten plus (10+) years of progressive / successful consultative business development solutions experience. Proven track-record of success in a senior IT position. The preferred experience base will have been gained in Information Technology Outsourcing (ITO) with Federal and State & Local customers.

Must possess a demonstrated track-record of structuring and winning long-term deals in the $10M to $1B range. This includes being able to understand the customer’s challenges to develop a blended-combination of technology and business solutions encompassing financial

models, service definitions, service level expectations and timeframes to help them meet their mission. This will be reflected by a background of leadership in the pursuit and closure of multi-year ITO and/or BPO services agreements.

Broad knowledge that spans a wide range of capabilities and their respective cost structures in the areas of managed services, end-to-end data center outsourcing, cloud advisory, and cloud transformation. Specific skills and experience in both AWS and Microsoft Azure are required. Knowledge of third-party tools as well as ITIL, Agile, SAFe, and DevSecOps methodologies is desired. This includes how these capabilities must be assembled into an operational delivery model that is both financially and technically sound.

Must understand the "numbers" and be able to drill down into the details and make the business case from financial perspective in developing accurate and standardized costing (pricing models) for delivery solutions. This will be supported by "hands-on" experience in managing, interpreting and executing balance sheets. Excellent planning and organizational skills-will bring the ability to respond appropriately to new business cycles across the scope of service offerings.

Strong executive presence and professional image. Exceptional communication skills (written and verbal). Ability to develop executive level (value-based) conversations with senior level decision makers (CEO, COO, CFO, CIO, etc.) and put together, or deliver, value-based proposals to clients in the targeted industry sectors.

A team player; someone comfortable working in a highly collaborative, team-oriented culture. Technical proposal writing skills a must. Must have the ability to effectively utilize and lead/direct Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) during the solutions development and sales pursuit process. Must be action and results-oriented - a "take-charge" leader with strong business case development and closing skills.

Must be willing to travel as business needs dictate.

POSITION SUMMARY: BASIC FUNCTION

The Data Center Facility Operations (DCFO) Technician provides basic support functions for the operations and maintenance activities on the data center electrical, mechanical, control, and fire life safety systems.

The DCFO Technician is responsible for understanding and following the processes governing the performance of work in the data center facility environment, including all applicable safety and operational work procedures.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Performs building rounds and inspections
Monitors Building Management Systems
Responds to abnormal facility conditions, incidents and emergencies using established operating procedures
Performs and assists in the performance of site operations and maintenance procedures
Creates and updates work orders
Researches and orders required tools, materials and consumables
Writes technical procedures for maintenance and repairs
Escorts and supervises external vendors and contractors
Assists in the creation of new work procedures in areas of expertise
Provides feedback on the effectiveness of existing processes and procedures
Performs Service Operations as required i.e., Tape Rotation, Rack and Stack of equipment, inventory hardware, power cycle devices, patch cable install/removal
Pursues qualification for higher level technical certifications
Performs other duties as assigned
Regular, predictable attendance is essential to satisfactory performance
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES
Possess an understanding of one or more of the mechanical, electrical, control and fire life safety systems of the type used in a data center environment including, but not limited to the following: electrical distribution, mechanical and electrical controls, diesel generators, backup power systems, HVAC systems, fire detection and suppression systems.
Working knowledge of industrial safety best practices (i.e. lockout/tag out, arc flash protection, OSHA and state regulations)
Demonstrated hands-on experience installing, maintaining, and/or troubleshooting industrial systems such as:
Chilled water systems
Centrifugal chillers
Cooling towers
Indirect air exchange heat wheel systems
Heat exchangers
Water Treatment Systems
VFD?s and pumps
HVAC equipment
Air handlers
Humidification systems
Water heaters
Water/Air filters
BMS and PLC Controls
Diesel generators
Fuel/oil systems
Medium and low voltage electrical distribution
Grounding and lightning protection systems
UPS systems
Fire detection and suppression systems
Good communication skills, both written and oral
Ability to communicate effectively with customers and internal staff, and work collaboratively in a team environment
Ability to learn quickly and address issues as they arise
Ability to operate in a rigorous process-driven environment
Ability to coordinate and communicate with outside vendors and contractors
Ability to logically analyze and solve problems
Ability to operate Hand and Machine Tools (hammer, drill, saw, etc.)
Ability to operate test and measurement tools, such as a multi-meter or flowmeter
Familiarity with MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Possess critical thinking and complex problem solving skills
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE
High School Diploma required
Associate?s Degree or equivalent education and/or work experience and a minimum of 2 years in an industrial mechanical/electrical position
Data center or other critical facility environment work experience is desired
Possession of CPR/First Aid/AED and NFPA70E certification or the ability to obtain after hire
Possession of an OSHA approved forklift certification or the ability to obtain one after hire
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
Primarily walking, standing, and bending with some sitting
Close visual work on a computer terminal
Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate any required equipment as well as to operate computer keyboard, mouse, and other technical instruments
Able to lift and carry heavy equipment, up to 50 pounds
Ability to climb ladders and work on raised platform
WORK CONDITIONS
Data Center environment with varying temperatures and loud noises
Potential extensive daily usage of workstation or computer
Must work on-site; no telecommuting permitted

About Us


Simon Data was founded in 2015 by a team of successful serial entrepreneurs. We are an enterprise customer data platform that empowers marketers to create personalized data-driven experiences for the customers. We're scrappy problem solvers who believe in tackling big challenges with disruptive thinking and giving our customers the support they need to deliver great next-generation experiences at scale.

Simon Data is a data-first customer experience orchestration platform, designed to disrupt the marketing technology and marketing cloud category. Simon's platform empowers businesses to use enterprise-scale data and machine learning to power customer communications across every channel. Our unique approach allows brands to develop one-to-one relationships with their customers without building a bespoke in-house data infrastructure.

At Simon, we firmly believe that business success starts and ends with people. We all do our best work when we are surrounded by other friendly top performers who want to succeed together. This attitude is core to our values. When you trust your team, invest in their development, and give them ownership, great things happen.

The Role


As a Demand Generation Marketing Manager at Simon Data, you will formulate sustainable campaign strategies that build awareness and drive qualified leads to our sales team. We are looking for someone to own and scale our channel marketing by optimizing paid media, coordinating our social media approach, building compelling email marketing programs, amplifying our content, and supporting lead generation at events.

Your typical day might include working closely with sales and product marketing to determine our next activation, monitoring dashboards to figure out positive/negative channel performance, so we can react swiftly, building copy and design to support promotional content into landing pages, emails, or social media, and ensuring it's all measured and tracked.

The right person for this position is a driven, analytical marketer looking to directly impact the revenue at a fast-growing tech startup. They especially enjoy digital marketing, data, and finding creative ways to drive interest. If you possess a love of owning the process from end-to-end, are a skilled communicator, inventive problem solver, and are adept at balancing multiple responsibilities, this opportunity is a phenomenal fit.

A massive benefit of owning demand generation at Simon is that there is plenty of room to grow and your success in this role will be highly transparent to the greater organization!

If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you!

What You'll Do
Work with the Head of Marketing to develop a marketing campaign strategy that supports qualified pipeline contribution
Collaborate on new lead acquisition and prospect engagement programs
Own and execute demand and lead nurture programs on all of our channels
Coordinate with our product marketing, content, and sales teams to ensure constant alignment between our business goals and our activities
Report on and optimize demand gen activities, lead nurturing efficacy, and return on investment
Communicate business results to a wider Simon audience
Lead results-oriented project timelines, ensuring timely execution of campaigns, including scheduling, working with design, production turnaround, and distribution of materials
Ensure campaigns are executed on schedule and on budget
Develop and support crafting short-form content for email campaigns, landing pages, scripts, user and case studies, blogs, and social media as needed
Ensure process documentation for business partners that articulates demand generation activities such as objectives, target personas, key messages, program tactics, and timing, and regularly present/introduce this information to business functions
Provide recommendations on where improvements can be made
Assess feedback and input from sales, product marketing, and business leaders on the messages will influence our target market
Day-to-day campaign management
Qualifications
4+ years of professional work experience
2+ years demand generation experience, preferably in the B2B / SaaS market
Excellent communication skills. Comfortable collaborating with a team that is both in-person and remote.
Very strong analytical skills and a data focused mentality. We love Looker, Google Sheets, Salesforce, Google Data Studio etc. to help us tell the story of our program performance.
Highly organized, detail oriented and self-motivated with very strong project management skills
Proactive, with the ability to lead multiple projects concurrently and achieve measurable results
Teammate, with consensus-building skills
Demonstrated strength in problem solving and analytical skills
Bonus for understanding how to build and manage to a marketing contribution framework
Bonus for experience with Google Analytics and Adwords
Visa sponsorship for this role is currently not available.

Company Name:
NTT Global Data Centers Americas, Inc
4.8
Job Description:
POSITION SUMMARY: BASIC FUNCTION

The Data Center Technician provides a working level of data center knowledge and is responsible for the operational integrity and regulatory compliance of the data center electrical, mechanical, and fire life safety systems.

The Data Center Technician maintains and follows the processes that maximize customer uptime in the most cost-effective way. Ensures that data center problems are identified and repaired quickly, that contractors deliver quality services, and that internal customer demands are met.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Develops creative approaches to keep operational costs to a minimum, improve efficiency, and implement new strategies. Systems of responsibility include:

Mechanical responsibilities will include chilled water systems and components, HVAC systems such as roof top units, CRAC/CRAH units, and humidification systems.

Electrical responsibilities will include electrical/critical power distribution from the Utility/Generator main switchgear through the UPS systems out to the customer load.

Fire Life Safety responsibilities will include wet sprinkler systems and pre-action sprinkler systems as well as their associated detection devices.

Tests performance of electromechanical assemblies and electronic voltmeters.

Reads blueprints, schematics, diagrams, or technical order to determine methods and sequences of processes.

Inspects parts for surface defects.

Installs electrical or electronic parts and hardware in housings or assemblies, using hand tools.

Aligns, fits or assembles component parts, using hand or power tools.

Operates, monitors, maintains, and responds to abnormal conditions in facilities systems. Areas include: Mechanical, Electrical, Fire Life Safety, and Building Monitoring and Control

Analyzes systems to ensure best practices for both internal and external customers

Provides feedback to DCO Engineering on the effectiveness of existing standards and processes

Works with contractors and consultants to review quality assurance for all system expansions, corrections, and upgrades

Works with the CF Ops Lead Technician to track and complete an aggressive preventive and predictive maintenance program

Ensures data center operates at maximum operational efficiency, including analyzing existing operating conditions, recommending new technologies and improving overall efficiency, and cost reduction.

Manages systems to avoid unplanned customer-impacting events

Works with CF Ops Lead Technician to determine maintenance requirements for mechanical, electrical, and fire life safety systems.

Performs other duties as assigned

Regular, predictable attendance is essential to satisfactory performance..

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES

Possess an understanding of the mechanical, electrical, and fire life safety systems used in a data center environment including, but not limited to the following: electrical distribution and layout, Transformers, PLC?s, Generators, Switchgear, UPS systems, STS?, ATS? PDU?s, Chilled Water Systems, CRAC/CRAH?s, Pre-Action Sprinkler Systems

Knowledge of NEC, NFPA 70E, NFPA 72, NFPA 25, and compliance issues as well as building codes in regard to fire life safety

Current knowledge in industrial safety best practices (i.e. lockout/tag out, arc flash protection, OSHA and state regulations)

Familiarity with data trending / tracking and analysis and the ability to utilize a PC based integrated critical monitoring systems

Ability to process Hands and Eye requests as required i.e., Tape Rotation, Rack and Stack of equipment, inventory hardware, power cycle devices, patch cable install/removal

Demonstrated hands-on experience installing, maintaining, and/or troubleshooting large commercial and industrial systems including:

Chilled Water Systems

Large Centrifugal Chillers

Cooling Towers

Heat Exchangers

Water Treatment Systems

VFD?s and Pumps

HVAC equipment

CRAC/CRAH?s

Humidification Systems

Water heaters

Water/Air filters

BMS and PLC Controls

Emergency Standby Diesel Generator Systems

Fuel/Oil systems,

480/277 and 208/120 electrical generation and distribution

Static UPS Systems

Double Interlock Pre-Action Systems

Excellent communication skills, both written and oral

Proficient with MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project)

Ability to communicate effectively with customers and internal staff and effectively work in team environment

Ability to coordinate, supervise, and communicate with contractors who perform maintenance or upgrade work on these systems.

Ability to learn quickly and address issues as they arise during normal working hours or after hours.

Ability to operate in and promote a rigorous process-driven team environment

Ability to logically analyze and solve problems

Ability to effectively multi-task multiple projects

Ability to operate Hand and Machine Tools (hammer, drill, saw, etc.)

Ability to operate electrical tools such as a multi-meter or infrared camera

Ability to operate a forklift

Must be comfortable working in a high stress, fast paced environment with shifting priorities.

Must be able to work on a shift which may require nights, holidays, and some weekends.

Possess critical thinking and complex problem solving skills

L1 EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE

High School Diploma required.

Associate?s Degree or equivalent education and/or work experience and a minimum of 2 years in a mechanical/electrical position within critical facilities (preferably a data center, hospital, semi-conductor, or power plant) required.

CPR/First Aid and NFPA70E Certified during employment.

Possession of an OSHA approved forklift certification or the ability to obtain one after hire required.

L2 EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE

Associate of Science in Technology degree or equivalent education and/or work experience plus

Minimum of 3 years in a mechanical/electrical position within critical facilities (preferably a data center, hospital, semi-conductor, or power plant)

CPR/First Aid and NFPA70ECertification during employment

Possession of an OSHA approved forklift certification or the ability to obtain one after hire is required

High School Diploma or GED required.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Primarily walking, standing, and bending with some sitting.

Ability to communicate effectively with verbal, visual and listening skills

Close visual work on a computer terminal.

Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate any required equipment as well as to operate computer keyboard, mouse, and other technical instruments.

Able to lift and carry heavy equipment, up to 50 pounds.

Ability to climb ladders and work on raised platform.

WORK CONDITIONS

Data Center environment with varying temperatures and loud noises.

Potential extensive daily usage of workstation or computer.

Must work on-site; no telecommuting permitted.

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS

Must be willing to be part of the after-hours notification and escalation protocol.

Must wear leather close-toed shoes with a solid rubber sole.

Must possess a current, valid state-issued driver?s license

Job Description:
Data Intensity is a pioneer and leader in the management of enterprise applications and underlying database technologies for Oracle and Microsoft environments. Offering both remote application management and managed cloud services, Data Intensity provides its customers a comprehensive, flexible, and cost-effective outsourcing solution that simplifies IT management and allows them to focus on their core businesses. The purpose-built solutions combine best-of-breed technology, world-class services, and deep-rooted expertise gained from hundreds of successful engagements across industries – including life sciences, manufacturing, high tech, financial services, and retail. The company was founded in 2001. It is headquartered in Bedford, MA with additional offices in Kentucky, Georgia, London, Poland, Russia, India, and Australia and data centers in Utah and Boston. Data Intensity was acquired by EQT Partners in August 2017.
Position Summary:
Customer Success Manager will be responsible for offering best practices and managing the technical aspects of maintaining customers environment. The CSM bridges the gap between operations and customer’s technical team and he/she is responsible for resolution of customers technical requests. It serves as the customer’s trusted technical advisor.

· Cloud Implementations
· Capacity Planning
· Backup and Recovery Testing

· Design and implement regular maintenance of application and database

Churn Management
· Influence customer lifetime value through higher product adoption, customer satisfaction & overall health scores

· Assist in scoping Professional Services Work

General & Administrative

Requirements

Data Concepts is seeking a Senior Associate for the Celebrity & Entertainment Program. The Associate will follow and implement the strategy for engaging and stewarding celebrity talent and entertainment properties in support of the of one of our clients.

Support the celebrity and branded entertainment strategy for the American Red Cross within annual, organization-wide campaigns as well as in times of regionally and nationally scoped disaster preparedness, response and recovery efforts
Build and nurture relationships with celebrities and media properties (music, TV, film) to support the Red Cross

Cultivate new prospects and introductions by leveraging industry contacts

Deep knowledge and facility with social media tools.

NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Enterprise Data Architect to join our team in Ft. Knox, Kentucky (US-KY), United States (US).

NTT DATA Services currently seeks an Enterprise Data Architect to join our team in Ft. Knox, Kentucky (US-KY), United States (US).

The EDA will participate in and improve communications, planning and collaboration between the CIO’s office programs and initiatives, and interfacing organizations and initiatives being delivered under separate contracts. These interfacing stakeholder organizations include Applications Development, IT Operations and Information Security.

The EDA will maintain, evolve, share and apply knowledge of industry and broader client stakeholder best practices and innovation with respect to successful enterprise information
governance, management and architecture delivery, as well as COTS, GOTS and stakeholder shared IT tools, standards and services that support.

Enterprise Information/Data Management is the primary focus area for the EDA, developing and maintaining the Enterprise Data Management Plan (DMP) and solution. The requirement includes “The DMP will encompass people (roles and responsibilities), processes (governance), and IT (tools and services) required to create a common understanding and consistent, proper handling of data across the HR enterprise. Boundaries and silos created by organizational structure shall be eliminated, and the baseline HR data is Visible, Accessible, Understandable, Trusted, and Interoperable (VAUTI), per the goals and objectives of the evolving Data Strategy. The contractor shall execute and maintain the enterprise data management program and implement a data management strategy which defines the goals, objectives, principles, business value, prioritization, metrics, and sequence plan used to make data, information, and IT services visible, accessible, understandable, trusted and interoperable throughout their lifecycle for all authorized users when needed and regardless of location or access device.”
Execution of the DMP will include the architecture, design, implementation and maintenance of the DMP tools (information and metadata registries, repositories and data quality capabilities), that “inform and deploy standards” for Data architecture, Data requirements, Data lineage, Data lifecycle management, Historical data, Records retention, Data archiving, Data integration, Data provenance.

The EDA will assess, recommend, design and instantiate decision-making processes and tools required to satisfy the client’s requirement to “implement and maintain a data governance
program that aligns with the client vision, goals, and objectives. The plan shall align stakeholders to the DMP’s implementation and management per the organization’s priorities and compliance mechanisms (including information security), and enable strong participation across the organization for critical decisions affecting data assets”.

The EDA will provide subject matter expertise across the client’s Enterprise Architecture portfolio, focusing on system and service architectures supporting secure information and data
management functions (as outlined in the DMP) within IT engineering environments, IT operations environments, CIO and program management environments, and client mission delivery environments (i.e. production applications and services).

Basic qualifications: Bachelor’s degree and with 10 years of relevant database experience or 14 years of experience in lieu of degree.

Preferred qualifications: Federal government and/or DoD/Army experience.

4.8
Job Description:
POSITION SUMMARY: BASIC FUNCTION

The Critical Facilities Operations (CF Ops) Data Center Technician L1 must possess a working level of data center knowledge, is responsible for the operational integrity and regulatory compliance of the data center electrical, mechanical, and fire life safety systems. Regular, predictable attendance is essential to satisfactory performance.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

This position will also be responsible for the processes that maximize customer uptime in the most cost-effective way. Technicians must ensure that data center problems are identified and repaired quickly, that contractors deliver quality services, and that internal customer demands are met. A L1 Technician develops creative approaches to keep operational costs to a minimum, improve efficiency, and implement new strategies.

Some key responsibilities include:
Mechanical responsibilities will include chilled water systems and components, HVAC systems such as roof top units, CRAC/CRAH units, and humidification systems.
Electrical responsibilities will include electrical/critical power distribution from the Utility/Generator main switchgear through the UPS systems out to the customer load.
Fire Life Safety responsibilities will include wet sprinkler systems and pre-action sprinkler systems as well as their associated detection devices.
Performs other duties as assigned.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES
Understanding of the mechanical, electrical, and fire life safety systems used in a data center environment including, but not limited to the following: electrical distribution and layout, Transformers, PLC’s, Generators, Switchgear, UPS systems, STS’, ATS’ PDU’s, Chilled Water Systems, CRAC/CRAH’s, Pre-Action Sprinkler Systems
Operates, monitors, maintains, and responds to abnormal conditions in facilities systems. Areas include: Mechanical, Electrical, Fire Life Safety, and Building Monitoring and Control
Analyzes systems to ensure best practices for both internal and external customers
Provides feedback to DCO Engineering on the effectiveness of existing standards and processes
Works with contractors and consultants to review quality assurance for all system expansions, corrections, and upgrades
Works with the CF Ops Lead Technician to track and complete an aggressive preventive and predictive maintenance program
Ensures data center operates at maximum operational efficiency, including analyzing existing operating conditions, recommending new technologies and improving overall efficiency, and cost reduction.
Manages systems to avoid unplanned customer-impacting events
Works with CF Ops Lead Technician to determine maintenance requirements for mechanical, electrical, and fire life safety systems
Knowledge of NEC, NFPA 70E, NFPA 72, NFPA 25, and compliance issues as well as building codes in regard to fire life safety
Current knowledge in industrial safety best practices (i.e. lockout/tag out, arc flash protection, OSHA and state regulations)
Familiarity with data trending / tracking and analysis and the ability to utilize a PC based integrated critical monitoring systems
Hands-on experience installing, maintaining, and/or troubleshooting large commercial and industrial systems including:
Chilled Water Systems
Large Centrifugal Chillers
Cooling Towers
Heat Exchangers
Water Treatment Systems
VFD’s and Pumps
HVAC equipment
CRAC/CRAH’s
Humidification Systems
Water heaters
Water/Air filters
BMS and PLC Controls
Emergency Standby Diesel Generator Systems
Fuel/Oil systems,
480/277 and 208/120 electrical generation and distribution
Static UPS Systems
Double Interlock Pre-Action Systems
Excellent communication skills, both written and oral
Proficient with MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project)
Ability to communicate effectively with customers and internal staff.
Ability to coordinate, supervise, and communicate with contractors who perform maintenance or upgrade work on these systems.
Ability to learn quickly and address issues as they arise during normal working hours or after hours.
Ability to operate in and promote a rigorous process-driven team environment
Ability to logically analyze and solve problems
Ability to effectively multi-task multiple projects
Operate Hand and Machine Tools (hammer, drill, saw, etc.)
Operate electrical tools such as a multi-meter or infrared camera.
Operate a forklift.
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE
Associate of Science in Technology or equivalent work experience normally obtained with 3-4 years’ related experience.
One to two years in a mechanical/electrical position within critical facilities (preference given to data center, hospital, semi-conductor, or power plant experience).
CPR/First Aid and NFPA70E Certified during employment.
Forklift certified during employment.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
Primarily walking, standing, and bending with some sitting.
Ability to communicate effectively with verbal, visual and listening skills
Close visual work on a computer terminal.
Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate any required equipment as well as to operate computer keyboard, mouse, and other technical instruments.
Able to lift and carry heavy equipment, up to 50 pounds.
Ability to climb ladders and work on raised platform.
WORK CONDITIONS
Data Center environment with varying temperatures and loud noises.
Potential extensive daily usage of workstation or computer.
Must work on-site; no telecommuting permitted.
SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS
Must be comfortable working in a high stress, fast paced environment with shifting priorities.
Must be able to work on a shift which may require nights, holidays, and some weekends.
Must be willing to be part of the after-hours notification and escalation protocol.
CPR/First Aid and NFPA70E Certification during employment.
Forklift certification during employment.
Must wear leather close-toed shoes with a solid rubber sole.
Must possess a current, valid state-issued driver’s license.

Experience working with customers and technology partners

Expertise in designing compelling dashboards that deliver a differentiated user experience
Experience with enterprise scale tableau roll outs will be a plus.

Knowledge and familiarity of building dashboards with AWS Redshift and Google Big Query will be preferred
Experience and knowledge of data modeling and data warehousing best practices will be preferred
Experience with multiple BI Tools and solutions will be a plus
Results driven attitude with a strong desire to build data platforms that enable 7Park Data’s insights across a massive and diverse set of data
Fearlessness in the pursuit of process improvement, implementation, and change
